text:
Oh, the joys of those who do not
    follow the advice of the wicked,
    or stand around with sinners,
    or join in with mockers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they delight in the law of the Lord,
    meditating on it day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are like trees planted along the riverbank,
    bearing fruit each season.
Their leaves never wither,
    and they prosper in all they do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But not the wicked!
    They are like worthless chaff, scattered by the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will be condemned at the time of judgment.
    Sinners will have no place among the godly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord watches over the path of the godly,
    but the path of the wicked leads to destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are the nations so angry?
    Why do they waste their time with futile plans?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings of the earth prepare for battle;
    the rulers plot together
against the Lord
    and against his anointed one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Let us break their chains,” they cry,
    “and free ourselves from slavery to God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the one who rules in heaven laughs.
    The Lord scoffs at them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then in anger he rebukes them,
    terrifying them with his fierce fury.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord declares, “I have placed my chosen king on the throne
    in Jerusalem, on my holy mountain.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king proclaims the Lord’s decree:
“The Lord said to me, ‘You are my son.
    Today I have become your Father.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Only ask, and I will give you the nations as your inheritance,
    the whole earth as your possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will break them with an iron rod
    and smash them like clay pots.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now then, you kings, act wisely!
    Be warned, you rulers of the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Serve the Lord with reverent fear,
    and rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Submit to God’s royal son, or he will become angry,
    and you will be destroyed in the midst of all your activities—
for his anger flares up in an instant.
    But what joy for all who take refuge in him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I have so many enemies;
    so many are against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So many are saying,
    “God will never rescue him!” Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, are a shield around me;
    you are my glory, the one who holds my head high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried out to the Lord,
    and he answered me from his holy mountain. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lay down and slept,
    yet I woke up in safety,
    for the Lord was watching over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am not afraid of ten thousand enemies
    who surround me on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord!
    Rescue me, my God!
Slap all my enemies in the face!
    Shatter the teeth of the wicked!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Victory comes from you, O Lord.
    May you bless your people. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Answer me when I call to you,
    O God who declares me innocent.
Free me from my troubles.
    Have mercy on me and hear my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long will you people ruin my reputation?
    How long will you make groundless accusations?
    How long will you continue your lies? Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
You can be sure of this:
    The Lord set apart the godly for himself.
    The Lord will answer when I call to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t sin by letting anger control you.
    Think about it overnight and remain silent. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer sacrifices in the right spirit,
    and trust the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many people say, “Who will show us better times?”
    Let your face smile on us, Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given me greater joy
    than those who have abundant harvests of grain and new wine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In peace I will lie down and sleep,
    for you alone, O Lord, will keep me safe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, hear me as I pray;
    pay attention to my groaning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my cry for help, my King and my God,
    for I pray to no one but you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my voice in the morning, Lord.
    Each morning I bring my requests to you and wait expectantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, you take no pleasure in wickedness;
    you cannot tolerate the sins of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, the proud may not stand in your presence,
    for you hate all who do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will destroy those who tell lies.
    The Lord detests murderers and deceivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of your unfailing love, I can enter your house;
    I will worship at your Temple with deepest awe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lead me in the right path, O Lord,
    or my enemies will conquer me.
Make your way plain for me to follow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies cannot speak a truthful word.
    Their deepest desire is to destroy others.
Their talk is foul, like the stench from an open grave.
    Their tongues are filled with flattery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, declare them guilty.
    Let them be caught in their own traps.
Drive them away because of their many sins,
    for they have rebelled against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But let all who take refuge in you rejoice;
    let them sing joyful praises forever.
Spread your protection over them,
    that all who love your name may be filled with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you bless the godly, O Lord;
    you surround them with your shield of love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, don’t rebuke me in your anger
    or discipline me in your rage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have compassion on me, Lord, for I am weak.
    Heal me, Lord, for my bones are in agony.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am sick at heart.
    How long, O Lord, until you restore me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, O Lord, and rescue me.
    Save me because of your unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the dead do not remember you.
    Who can praise you from the grave?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am worn out from sobbing.
    All night I flood my bed with weeping,
    drenching it with my tears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My vision is blurred by grief;
    my eyes are worn out because of all my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go away, all you who do evil,
    for the Lord has heard my weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has heard my plea;
    the Lord will answer my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all my enemies be disgraced and terrified.
    May they suddenly turn back in shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I come to you for protection, O Lord my God.
    Save me from my persecutors—rescue me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you don’t, they will maul me like a lion,
    tearing me to pieces with no one to rescue me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, if I have done wrong
    or am guilty of injustice,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if I have betrayed a friend
    or plundered my enemy without cause,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then let my enemies capture me.
    Let them trample me into the ground
    and drag my honor in the dust. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord, in anger!
    Stand up against the fury of my enemies!
    Wake up, my God, and bring justice!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gather the nations before you.
    Rule over them from on high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord judges the nations.
Declare me righteous, O Lord,
    for I am innocent, O Most High!
speaker: Narrator

text:
End the evil of those who are wicked,
    and defend the righteous.
For you look deep within the mind and heart,
    O righteous God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is my shield,
    saving those whose hearts are true and right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is an honest judge.
    He is angry with the wicked every day.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He will prepare his deadly weapons
    and shoot his flaming arrows.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They dig a deep pit to trap others,
    then fall into it themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The trouble they make for others backfires on them.
    The violence they plan falls on their own heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will thank the Lord because he is just;
    I will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, our Lord, your majestic name fills the earth!
    Your glory is higher than the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have taught children and infants
    to tell of your strength,
silencing your enemies
    and all who oppose you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I look at the night sky and see the work of your fingers—
    the moon and the stars you set in place—
speaker: Narrator

text:
what are mere mortals that you should think about them,
    human beings that you should care for them?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you made them only a little lower than God
    and crowned them with glory and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You gave them charge of everything you made,
    putting all things under their authority—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the flocks and the herds
    and all the wild animals,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the birds in the sky, the fish in the sea,
    and everything that swims the ocean currents.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, our Lord, your majestic name fills the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart;
    I will tell of all the marvelous things you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be filled with joy because of you.
    I will sing praises to your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies retreated;
    they staggered and died when you appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have judged in my favor;
    from your throne you have judged with fairness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked;
    you have erased their names forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The enemy is finished, in endless ruins;
    the cities you uprooted are now forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord reigns forever,
    executing judgment from his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will judge the world with justice
    and rule the nations with fairness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is a shelter for the oppressed,
    a refuge in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who know your name trust in you,
    for you, O Lord, do not abandon those who search for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to the Lord who reigns in Jerusalem.
    Tell the world about his unforgettable deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he who avenges murder cares for the helpless.
    He does not ignore the cries of those who suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, have mercy on me.
    See how my enemies torment me.
    Snatch me back from the jaws of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me so I can praise you publicly at Jerusalem’s gates,
    so I can rejoice that you have rescued me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations have fallen into the pit they dug for others.
    Their own feet have been caught in the trap they set.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is known for his justice.
    The wicked are trapped by their own deeds. Quiet Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked will go down to the grave.
    This is the fate of all the nations who ignore God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the needy will not be ignored forever;
    the hopes of the poor will not always be crushed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord!
    Do not let mere mortals defy you!
    Judge the nations!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make them tremble in fear, O Lord.
    Let the nations know they are merely human. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, why do you stand so far away?
    Why do you hide when I am in trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked arrogantly hunt down the poor.
    Let them be caught in the evil they plan for others.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they brag about their evil desires;
    they praise the greedy and curse the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are too proud to seek God.
    They seem to think that God is dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet they succeed in everything they do.
    They do not see your punishment awaiting them.
    They sneer at all their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They think, “Nothing bad will ever happen to us!
    We will be free of trouble forever!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their mouths are full of cursing, lies, and threats.
    Trouble and evil are on the tips of their tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They lurk in ambush in the villages,
    waiting to murder innocent people.
    They are always searching for helpless victims.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like lions crouched in hiding,
    they wait to pounce on the helpless.
Like hunters they capture the helpless
    and drag them away in nets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their helpless victims are crushed;
    they fall beneath the strength of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked think, “God isn’t watching us!
    He has closed his eyes and won’t even see what we do!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord!
    Punish the wicked, O God!
    Do not ignore the helpless!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do the wicked get away with despising God?
    They think, “God will never call us to account.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you see the trouble and grief they cause.
    You take note of it and punish them.
The helpless put their trust in you.
    You defend the orphans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Break the arms of these wicked, evil people!
    Go after them until the last one is destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is king forever and ever!
    The godless nations will vanish from the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, you know the hopes of the helpless.
    Surely you will hear their cries and comfort them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will bring justice to the orphans and the oppressed,
    so mere people can no longer terrify them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I trust in the Lord for protection.
So why do you say to me,
    “Fly like a bird to the mountains for safety!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are stringing their bows
    and fitting their arrows on the bowstrings.
They shoot from the shadows
    at those whose hearts are right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The foundations of law and order have collapsed.
    What can the righteous do?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord is in his holy Temple;
    the Lord still rules from heaven.
He watches everyone closely,
    examining every person on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord examines both the righteous and the wicked.
    He hates those who love violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will rain down blazing coals and burning sulfur on the wicked,
    punishing them with scorching winds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the righteous Lord loves justice.
    The virtuous will see his face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help, O Lord, for the godly are fast disappearing!
    The faithful have vanished from the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Neighbors lie to each other,
    speaking with flattering lips and deceitful hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord cut off their flattering lips
    and silence their boastful tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say, “We will lie to our hearts’ content.
    Our lips are our own—who can stop us?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord replies, “I have seen violence done to the helpless,
    and I have heard the groans of the poor.
Now I will rise up to rescue them,
    as they have longed for me to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s promises are pure,
    like silver refined in a furnace,
    purified seven times over.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, Lord, we know you will protect the oppressed,
    preserving them forever from this lying generation,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even though the wicked strut about,
    and evil is praised throughout the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, how long will you forget me? Forever?
    How long will you look the other way?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long must I struggle with anguish in my soul,
    with sorrow in my heart every day?
    How long will my enemy have the upper hand?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn and answer me, O Lord my God!
    Restore the sparkle to my eyes, or I will die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let my enemies gloat, saying, “We have defeated him!”
    Don’t let them rejoice at my downfall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I trust in your unfailing love.
    I will rejoice because you have rescued me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord
    because he is good to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Only fools say in their hearts,
    “There is no God.”
They are corrupt, and their actions are evil;
    not one of them does good!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord looks down from heaven
    on the entire human race;
he looks to see if anyone is truly wise,
    if anyone seeks God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But no, all have turned away;
    all have become corrupt.
No one does good,
    not a single one!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will those who do evil never learn?
    They eat up my people like bread
    and wouldn’t think of praying to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Terror will grip them,
    for God is with those who obey him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked frustrate the plans of the oppressed,
    but the Lord will protect his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will come from Mount Zion to rescue Israel?
    When the Lord restores his people,
    Jacob will shout with joy, and Israel will rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who may worship in your sanctuary, Lord?
    Who may enter your presence on your holy hill?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who lead blameless lives and do what is right,
    speaking the truth from sincere hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who refuse to gossip
    or harm their neighbors
    or speak evil of their friends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who despise flagrant sinners,
    and honor the faithful followers of the Lord,
    and keep their promises even when it hurts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who lend money without charging interest,
    and who cannot be bribed to lie about the innocent.
Such people will stand firm forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me safe, O God,
    for I have come to you for refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said to the Lord, “You are my Master!
    Every good thing I have comes from you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The godly people in the land
    are my true heroes!
    I take pleasure in them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Troubles multiply for those who chase after other gods.
    I will not take part in their sacrifices of blood
    or even speak the names of their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, you alone are my inheritance, my cup of blessing.
    You guard all that is mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The land you have given me is a pleasant land.
    What a wonderful inheritance!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless the Lord who guides me;
    even at night my heart instructs me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know the Lord is always with me.
    I will not be shaken, for he is right beside me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No wonder my heart is glad, and I rejoice.
    My body rests in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will not leave my soul among the dead
    or allow your holy one to rot in the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will show me the way of life,
    granting me the joy of your presence
    and the pleasures of living with you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, hear my plea for justice.
    Listen to my cry for help.
Pay attention to my prayer,
    for it comes from honest lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare me innocent,
    for you see those who do right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have tested my thoughts and examined my heart in the night.
    You have scrutinized me and found nothing wrong.
    I am determined not to sin in what I say.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have followed your commands,
    which keep me from following cruel and evil people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My steps have stayed on your path;
    I have not wavered from following you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am praying to you because I know you will answer, O God.
    Bend down and listen as I pray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show me your unfailing love in wonderful ways.
    By your mighty power you rescue
    those who seek refuge from their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guard me as you would guard your own eyes.
    Hide me in the shadow of your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Protect me from wicked people who attack me,
    from murderous enemies who surround me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are without pity.
    Listen to their boasting!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They track me down and surround me,
    watching for the chance to throw me to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are like hungry lions, eager to tear me apart—
    like young lions hiding in ambush.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord!
    Stand against them, and bring them to their knees!
    Rescue me from the wicked with your sword!
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the power of your hand, O Lord,
    destroy those who look to this world for their reward.
But satisfy the hunger of your treasured ones.
    May their children have plenty,
    leaving an inheritance for their descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because I am righteous, I will see you.
    When I awake, I will see you face to face and be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love you, Lord;
    you are my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my rock, my fortress, and my savior;
    my God is my rock, in whom I find protection.
He is my shield, the power that saves me,
    and my place of safety.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I called on the Lord, who is worthy of praise,
    and he saved me from my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ropes of death entangled me;
    floods of destruction swept over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The grave wrapped its ropes around me;
    death laid a trap in my path.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
He opened the heavens and came down;
    dark storm clouds were beneath his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mounted on a mighty angelic being, he flew,
    soaring on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shrouded himself in darkness,
    veiling his approach with dark rain clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thick clouds shielded the brightness around him
    and rained down hail and burning coals.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He shot his arrows and scattered his enemies;
    great bolts of lightning flashed, and they were confused.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then at your command, O Lord,
    at the blast of your breath,
the bottom of the sea could be seen,
    and the foundations of the earth were laid bare.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He reached down from heaven and rescued me;
    he drew me out of deep waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rescued me from my powerful enemies,
    from those who hated me and were too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They attacked me at a moment when I was in distress,
    but the Lord supported me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led me to a place of safety;
    he rescued me because he delights in me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rewarded me for doing right;
    he restored me because of my innocence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have kept the ways of the Lord;
    I have not turned from my God to follow evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have followed all his regulations;
    I have never abandoned his decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am blameless before God;
    I have kept myself from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rewarded me for doing right.
    He has seen my innocence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To the faithful you show yourself faithful;
    to those with integrity you show integrity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To the pure you show yourself pure,
    but to the crooked you show yourself shrewd.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rescue the humble,
    but you humiliate the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You light a lamp for me.
    The Lord, my God, lights up my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your strength I can crush an army;
    with my God I can scale any wall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God’s way is perfect.
    All the Lord’s promises prove true.
    He is a shield for all who look to him for protection.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For who is God except the Lord?
    Who but our God is a solid rock?
speaker: Narrator

text:
God arms me with strength,
    and he makes my way perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes me as surefooted as a deer,
    enabling me to stand on mountain heights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He trains my hands for battle;
    he strengthens my arm to draw a bronze bow.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You have made a wide path for my feet
    to keep them from slipping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I chased my enemies and caught them;
    I did not stop until they were conquered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I struck them down so they could not get up;
    they fell beneath my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have armed me with strength for the battle;
    you have subdued my enemies under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You placed my foot on their necks.
    I have destroyed all who hated me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They called for help, but no one came to their rescue.
    They even cried to the Lord, but he refused to answer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I ground them as fine as dust in the wind.
    I swept them into the gutter like dirt.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
As soon as they hear of me, they submit;
    foreign nations cringe before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They all lose their courage
    and come trembling from their strongholds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord lives! Praise to my Rock!
    May the God of my salvation be exalted!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the God who pays back those who harm me;
    he subdues the nations under me
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For this, O Lord, I will praise you among the nations;
    I will sing praises to your name.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The heavens proclaim the glory of God.
    The skies display his craftsmanship.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day after day they continue to speak;
    night after night they make him known.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They speak without a sound or word;
    their voice is never heard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet their message has gone throughout the earth,
    and their words to all the world.
God has made a home in the heavens for the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It bursts forth like a radiant bridegroom after his wedding.
    It rejoices like a great athlete eager to run the race.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun rises at one end of the heavens
    and follows its course to the other end.
    Nothing can hide from its heat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The instructions of the Lord are perfect,
    reviving the soul.
The decrees of the Lord are trustworthy,
    making wise the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The commandments of the Lord are right,
    bringing joy to the heart.
The commands of the Lord are clear,
    giving insight for living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Reverence for the Lord is pure,
    lasting forever.
The laws of the Lord are true;
    each one is fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are more desirable than gold,
    even the finest gold.
They are sweeter than honey,
    even honey dripping from the comb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are a warning to your servant,
    a great reward for those who obey them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can I know all the sins lurking in my heart?
    Cleanse me from these hidden faults.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your servant from deliberate sins!
    Don’t let them control me.
Then I will be free of guilt
    and innocent of great sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the words of my mouth
    and the meditation of my heart
be pleasing to you,
    O Lord, my rock and my redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In times of trouble, may the Lord answer your cry.
    May the name of the God of Jacob keep you safe from all harm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he send you help from his sanctuary
    and strengthen you from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he remember all your gifts
    and look favorably on your burnt offerings. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he grant your heart’s desires
    and make all your plans succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May we shout for joy when we hear of your victory
    and raise a victory banner in the name of our God.
May the Lord answer all your prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now I know that the Lord rescues his anointed king.
    He will answer him from his holy heaven
    and rescue him by his great power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some nations boast of their chariots and horses,
    but we boast in the name of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those nations will fall down and collapse,
    but we will rise up and stand firm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give victory to our king, O Lord!
    Answer our cry for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How the king rejoices in your strength, O Lord!
    He shouts with joy because you give him victory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have given him his heart’s desire;
    you have withheld nothing he requested. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
You welcomed him back with success and prosperity.
    You placed a crown of finest gold on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked you to preserve his life,
    and you granted his request.
    The days of his life stretch on forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your victory brings him great honor,
    and you have clothed him with splendor and majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have endowed him with eternal blessings
    and given him the joy of your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the king trusts in the Lord.
    The unfailing love of the Most High will keep him from stumbling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will capture all your enemies.
    Your strong right hand will seize all who hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will throw them in a flaming furnace
    when you appear.
The Lord will consume them in his anger;
    fire will devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will wipe their children from the face of the earth;
    they will never have descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Although they plot against you,
    their evil schemes will never succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they will turn and run
    when they see your arrows aimed at them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up, O Lord, in all your power.
    With music and singing we celebrate your mighty acts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?
    Why are you so far away when I groan for help?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every day I call to you, my God, but you do not answer.
    Every night I lift my voice, but I find no relief.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you are holy,
    enthroned on the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our ancestors trusted in you,
    and you rescued them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried out to you and were saved.
    They trusted in you and were never disgraced.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am a worm and not a man.
    I am scorned and despised by all!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone who sees me mocks me.
    They sneer and shake their heads, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Is this the one who relies on the Lord?
    Then let the Lord save him!
If the Lord loves him so much,
    let the Lord rescue him!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you brought me safely from my mother’s womb
    and led me to trust you at my mother’s breast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was thrust into your arms at my birth.
    You have been my God from the moment I was born.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My enemies surround me like a herd of bulls;
    fierce bulls of Bashan have hemmed me in!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like lions they open their jaws against me,
    roaring and tearing into their prey.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My life is poured out like water,
    and all my bones are out of joint.
My heart is like wax,
    melting within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My strength has dried up like sunbaked clay.
    My tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth.
    You have laid me in the dust and left me for dead.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I can count all my bones.
    My enemies stare at me and gloat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They divide my garments among themselves
    and throw dice for my clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do not stay far away!
    You are my strength; come quickly to my aid!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me from the sword;
    spare my precious life from these dogs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Snatch me from the lion’s jaws
    and from the horns of these wild oxen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters.
    I will praise you among your assembled people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all you who fear him!
    Honor him, all you descendants of Jacob!
    Show him reverence, all you descendants of Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has not ignored or belittled the suffering of the needy.
    He has not turned his back on them,
    but has listened to their cries for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise you in the great assembly.
    I will fulfill my vows in the presence of those who worship you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The poor will eat and be satisfied.
    All who seek the Lord will praise him.
    Their hearts will rejoice with everlasting joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The whole earth will acknowledge the Lord and return to him.
    All the families of the nations will bow down before him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For royal power belongs to the Lord.
    He rules all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the rich of the earth feast and worship.
    Bow before him, all who are mortal,
    all whose lives will end as dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our children will also serve him.
    Future generations will hear about the wonders of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His righteous acts will be told to those not yet born.
    They will hear about everything he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my shepherd;
    I have all that I need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He lets me rest in green meadows;
    he leads me beside peaceful streams.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He renews my strength.
He guides me along right paths,
    bringing honor to his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even when I walk
    through the darkest valley,
I will not be afraid,
    for you are close beside me.
Your rod and your staff
    protect and comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You prepare a feast for me
    in the presence of my enemies.
You honor me by anointing my head with oil.
    My cup overflows with blessings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely your goodness and unfailing love will pursue me
    all the days of my life,
and I will live in the house of the Lord
    forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.
    The world and all its people belong to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he laid the earth’s foundation on the seas
    and built it on the ocean depths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who may climb the mountain of the Lord?
    Who may stand in his holy place?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Only those whose hands and hearts are pure,
    who do not worship idols
    and never tell lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will receive the Lord’s blessing
    and have a right relationship with God their savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Such people may seek you
    and worship in your presence, O God of Jacob. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open up, ancient gates!
    Open up, ancient doors,
    and let the King of glory enter.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Open up, ancient gates!
    Open up, ancient doors,
    and let the King of glory enter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is the King of glory?
    The Lord of Heaven’s Armies—
    he is the King of glory. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I give my life to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I trust in you, my God!
Do not let me be disgraced,
    or let my enemies rejoice in my defeat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No one who trusts in you will ever be disgraced,
    but disgrace comes to those who try to deceive others.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show me the right path, O Lord;
    point out the road for me to follow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lead me by your truth and teach me,
    for you are the God who saves me.
    All day long I put my hope in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember, O Lord, your compassion and unfailing love,
    which you have shown from long ages past.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not remember the rebellious sins of my youth.
    Remember me in the light of your unfailing love,
    for you are merciful, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is good and does what is right;
    he shows the proper path to those who go astray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He leads the humble in doing right,
    teaching them his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord leads with unfailing love and faithfulness
    all who keep his covenant and obey his demands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the honor of your name, O Lord,
    forgive my many, many sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who are those who fear the Lord?
    He will show them the path they should choose.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will live in prosperity,
    and their children will inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is a friend to those who fear him.
    He teaches them his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are always on the Lord,
    for he rescues me from the traps of my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me and have mercy,
    for I am alone and in deep distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My problems go from bad to worse.
    Oh, save me from them all!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Feel my pain and see my trouble.
    Forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how many enemies I have
    and how viciously they hate me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Protect me! Rescue my life from them!
    Do not let me be disgraced, for in you I take refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May integrity and honesty protect me,
    for I put my hope in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, ransom Israel
    from all its troubles.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Put me on trial, Lord, and cross-examine me.
    Test my motives and my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am always aware of your unfailing love,
    and I have lived according to your truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do not spend time with liars
    or go along with hypocrites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate the gatherings of those who do evil,
    and I refuse to join in with the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wash my hands to declare my innocence.
    I come to your altar, O Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
singing a song of thanksgiving
    and telling of all your wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love your sanctuary, Lord,
    the place where your glorious presence dwells.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let me suffer the fate of sinners.
    Don’t condemn me along with murderers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their hands are dirty with evil schemes,
    and they constantly take bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am not like that; I live with integrity.
    So redeem me and show me mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now I stand on solid ground,
    and I will publicly praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my light and my salvation—
    so why should I be afraid?
The Lord is my fortress, protecting me from danger,
    so why should I tremble?
speaker: Narrator

text:
When evil people come to devour me,
    when my enemies and foes attack me,
    they will stumble and fall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though a mighty army surrounds me,
    my heart will not be afraid.
Even if I am attacked,
    I will remain confident.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one thing I ask of the Lord—
    the thing I seek most—
is to live in the house of the Lord all the days of my life,
    delighting in the Lord’s perfections
    and meditating in his Temple.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then I will hold my head high
    above my enemies who surround me.
At his sanctuary I will offer sacrifices with shouts of joy,
    singing and praising the Lord with music.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear me as I pray, O Lord.
    Be merciful and answer me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart has heard you say, “Come and talk with me.”
    And my heart responds, “Lord, I am coming.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not turn your back on me.
    Do not reject your servant in anger.
    You have always been my helper.
Don’t leave me now; don’t abandon me,
    O God of my salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even if my father and mother abandon me,
    the Lord will hold me close.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me how to live, O Lord.
    Lead me along the right path,
    for my enemies are waiting for me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Yet I am confident I will see the Lord’s goodness
    while I am here in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wait patiently for the Lord.
    Be brave and courageous.
    Yes, wait patiently for the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pray to you, O Lord, my rock.
    Do not turn a deaf ear to me.
For if you are silent,
    I might as well give up and die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my prayer for mercy
    as I cry out to you for help,
    as I lift my hands toward your holy sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not drag me away with the wicked—
    with those who do evil—
those who speak friendly words to their neighbors
    while planning evil in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give them the punishment they so richly deserve!
    Measure it out in proportion to their wickedness.
Pay them back for all their evil deeds!
    Give them a taste of what they have done to others.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They care nothing for what the Lord has done
    or for what his hands have made.
So he will tear them down,
    and they will never be rebuilt!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
    For he has heard my cry for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my strength and shield.
    I trust him with all my heart.
He helps me, and my heart is filled with joy.
    I burst out in songs of thanksgiving.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord gives his people strength.
    He is a safe fortress for his anointed king.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save your people!
    Bless Israel, your special possession.
Lead them like a shepherd,
    and carry them in your arms forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor the Lord, you heavenly beings;
    honor the Lord for his glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor the Lord for the glory of his name.
    Worship the Lord in the splendor of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord echoes above the sea.
    The God of glory thunders.
    The Lord thunders over the mighty sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord is powerful;
    the voice of the Lord is majestic.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord splits the mighty cedars;
    the Lord shatters the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes Lebanon’s mountains skip like a calf;
    he makes Mount Hermon leap like a young wild ox.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord strikes
    with bolts of lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord makes the barren wilderness quake;
    the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord twists mighty oaks
    and strips the forests bare.
In his Temple everyone shouts, “Glory!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rules over the floodwaters.
    The Lord reigns as king forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord gives his people strength.
    The Lord blesses them with peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will exalt you, Lord, for you rescued me.
    You refused to let my enemies triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, I cried to you for help,
    and you restored my health.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You brought me up from the grave, O Lord.
    You kept me from falling into the pit of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord, all you godly ones!
    Praise his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For his anger lasts only a moment,
    but his favor lasts a lifetime!
Weeping may last through the night,
    but joy comes with the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I was prosperous, I said,
    “Nothing can stop me now!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your favor, O Lord, made me as secure as a mountain.
    Then you turned away from me, and I was shattered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried out to you, O Lord.
    I begged the Lord for mercy, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“What will you gain if I die,
    if I sink into the grave?
Can my dust praise you?
    Can it tell of your faithfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear me, Lord, and have mercy on me.
    Help me, O Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have turned my mourning into joyful dancing.
    You have taken away my clothes of mourning and clothed me with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I might sing praises to you and not be silent.
    O Lord my God, I will give you thanks forever!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Turn your ear to listen to me;
    rescue me quickly.
Be my rock of protection,
    a fortress where I will be safe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my rock and my fortress.
    For the honor of your name, lead me out of this danger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pull me from the trap my enemies set for me,
    for I find protection in you alone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I entrust my spirit into your hand.
    Rescue me, Lord, for you are a faithful God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate those who worship worthless idols.
    I trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You have not handed me over to my enemies
    but have set me in a safe place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have mercy on me, Lord, for I am in distress.
    Tears blur my eyes.
    My body and soul are withering away.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I am scorned by all my enemies
    and despised by my neighbors—
    even my friends are afraid to come near me.
When they see me on the street,
    they run the other way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am ignored as if I were dead,
    as if I were a broken pot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have heard the many rumors about me,
    and I am surrounded by terror.
My enemies conspire against me,
    plotting to take my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am trusting you, O Lord,
    saying, “You are my God!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My future is in your hands.
    Rescue me from those who hunt me down relentlessly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your favor shine on your servant.
    In your unfailing love, rescue me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let me be disgraced, O Lord,
    for I call out to you for help.
Let the wicked be disgraced;
    let them lie silent in the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Silence their lying lips—
    those proud and arrogant lips that accuse the godly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How great is the goodness
    you have stored up for those who fear you.
You lavish it on those who come to you for protection,
    blessing them before the watching world.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hide them in the shelter of your presence,
    safe from those who conspire against them.
You shelter them in your presence,
    far from accusing tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord,
    for he has shown me the wonders of his unfailing love.
    He kept me safe when my city was under attack.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In panic I cried out,
    “I am cut off from the Lord!”
But you heard my cry for mercy
    and answered my call for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Love the Lord, all you godly ones!
    For the Lord protects those who are loyal to him,
    but he harshly punishes the arrogant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So be strong and courageous,
    all you who put your hope in the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, what joy for those
    whose disobedience is forgiven,
    whose sin is put out of sight!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, what joy for those
    whose record the Lord has cleared of guilt,
    whose lives are lived in complete honesty!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I refused to confess my sin,
    my body wasted away,
    and I groaned all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day and night your hand of discipline was heavy on me.
    My strength evaporated like water in the summer heat. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Finally, I confessed all my sins to you
    and stopped trying to hide my guilt.
I said to myself, “I will confess my rebellion to the Lord.”
    And you forgave me! All my guilt is gone. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, let all the godly pray to you while there is still time,
    that they may not drown in the floodwaters of judgment.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord says, “I will guide you along the best pathway for your life.
    I will advise you and watch over you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be like a senseless horse or mule
    that needs a bit and bridle to keep it under control.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many sorrows come to the wicked,
    but unfailing love surrounds those who trust the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So rejoice in the Lord and be glad, all you who obey him!
    Shout for joy, all you whose hearts are pure!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the godly sing for joy to the Lord;
    it is fitting for the pure to praise him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord with melodies on the lyre;
    make music for him on the ten-stringed harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing a new song of praise to him;
    play skillfully on the harp, and sing with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the word of the Lord holds true,
    and we can trust everything he does.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He loves whatever is just and good;
    the unfailing love of the Lord fills the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord merely spoke,
    and the heavens were created.
He breathed the word,
    and all the stars were born.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He assigned the sea its boundaries
    and locked the oceans in vast reservoirs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the whole world fear the Lord,
    and let everyone stand in awe of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For when he spoke, the world began!
    It appeared at his command.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord frustrates the plans of the nations
    and thwarts all their schemes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord’s plans stand firm forever;
    his intentions can never be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What joy for the nation whose God is the Lord,
    whose people he has chosen as his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord looks down from heaven
    and sees the whole human race.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From his throne he observes
    all who live on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made their hearts,
    so he understands everything they do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The best-equipped army cannot save a king,
    nor is great strength enough to save a warrior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t count on your warhorse to give you victory—
    for all its strength, it cannot save you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord watches over those who fear him,
    those who rely on his unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rescues them from death
    and keeps them alive in times of famine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We put our hope in the Lord.
    He is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In him our hearts rejoice,
    for we trust in his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your unfailing love surround us, Lord,
    for our hope is in you alone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise the Lord at all times.
    I will constantly speak his praises.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will boast only in the Lord;
    let all who are helpless take heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let us tell of the Lord’s greatness;
    let us exalt his name together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I prayed to the Lord, and he answered me.
    He freed me from all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who look to him for help will be radiant with joy;
    no shadow of shame will darken their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my desperation I prayed, and the Lord listened;
    he saved me from all my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the angel of the Lord is a guard;
    he surrounds and defends all who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Taste and see that the Lord is good.
    Oh, the joys of those who take refuge in him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fear the Lord, you his godly people,
    for those who fear him will have all they need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even strong young lions sometimes go hungry,
    but those who trust in the Lord will lack no good thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, my children, and listen to me,
    and I will teach you to fear the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does anyone want to live a life
    that is long and prosperous?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then keep your tongue from speaking evil
    and your lips from telling lies!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away from evil and do good.
    Search for peace, and work to maintain it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of the Lord watch over those who do right;
    his ears are open to their cries for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord turns his face against those who do evil;
    he will erase their memory from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord hears his people when they call to him for help.
    He rescues them from all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is close to the brokenhearted;
    he rescues those whose spirits are crushed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous person faces many troubles,
    but the Lord comes to the rescue each time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord protects the bones of the righteous;
    not one of them is broken!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Calamity will surely destroy the wicked,
    and those who hate the righteous will be punished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord will redeem those who serve him.
    No one who takes refuge in him will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, oppose those who oppose me.
    Fight those who fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put on your armor, and take up your shield.
    Prepare for battle, and come to my aid.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your spear and javelin
    against those who pursue me.
Let me hear you say,
    “I will give you victory!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bring shame and disgrace on those trying to kill me;
    turn them back and humiliate those who want to harm me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow them away like chaff in the wind—
    a wind sent by the angel of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make their path dark and slippery,
    with the angel of the Lord pursuing them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I did them no wrong, but they laid a trap for me.
    I did them no wrong, but they dug a pit to catch me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So let sudden ruin come upon them!
    Let them be caught in the trap they set for me!
    Let them be destroyed in the pit they dug for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will rejoice in the Lord.
    I will be glad because he rescues me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With every bone in my body I will praise him:
    “Lord, who can compare with you?
Who else rescues the helpless from the strong?
    Who else protects the helpless and poor from those who rob them?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Malicious witnesses testify against me.
    They accuse me of crimes I know nothing about.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They repay me evil for good.
    I am sick with despair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet when they were ill, I grieved for them.
    I denied myself by fasting for them,
    but my prayers returned unanswered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was sad, as though they were my friends or family,
    as if I were grieving for my own mother.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They mock me and call me names;
    they snarl at me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord, will you look on and do nothing?
    Rescue me from their fierce attacks.
    Protect my life from these lions!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will thank you in front of the great assembly.
    I will praise you before all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let my treacherous enemies rejoice over my defeat.
    Don’t let those who hate me without cause gloat over my sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They don’t talk of peace;
    they plot against innocent people who mind their own business.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shout, “Aha! Aha!
    With our own eyes we saw him do it!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you know all about this.
    Do not stay silent.
    Do not abandon me now, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up! Rise to my defense!
    Take up my case, my God and my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare me not guilty, O Lord my God, for you give justice.
    Don’t let my enemies laugh about me in my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let them say, “Look, we got what we wanted!
    Now we will eat him alive!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
May those who rejoice at my troubles
    be humiliated and disgraced.
May those who triumph over me
    be covered with shame and dishonor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But give great joy to those who came to my defense.
    Let them continually say, “Great is the Lord,
    who delights in blessing his servant with peace!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will proclaim your justice,
    and I will praise you all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sin whispers to the wicked, deep within their hearts.
    They have no fear of God at all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In their blind conceit,
    they cannot see how wicked they really are.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everything they say is crooked and deceitful.
    They refuse to act wisely or do good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They lie awake at night, hatching sinful plots.
    Their actions are never good.
    They make no attempt to turn from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your unfailing love, O Lord, is as vast as the heavens;
    your faithfulness reaches beyond the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains,
    your justice like the ocean depths.
You care for people and animals alike, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How precious is your unfailing love, O God!
All humanity finds shelter
    in the shadow of your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You feed them from the abundance of your own house,
    letting them drink from your river of delights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are the fountain of life,
    the light by which we see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pour out your unfailing love on those who love you;
    give justice to those with honest hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let the proud trample me
    or the wicked push me around.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look! Those who do evil have fallen!
    They are thrown down, never to rise again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t worry about the wicked
    or envy those who do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For like grass, they soon fade away.
    Like spring flowers, they soon wither.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust in the Lord and do good.
    Then you will live safely in the land and prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take delight in the Lord,
    and he will give you your heart’s desires.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Commit everything you do to the Lord.
    Trust him, and he will help you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will make your innocence radiate like the dawn,
    and the justice of your cause will shine like the noonday sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be still in the presence of the Lord,
    and wait patiently for him to act.
Don’t worry about evil people who prosper
    or fret about their wicked schemes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Stop being angry!
    Turn from your rage!
Do not lose your temper—
    it only leads to harm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the wicked will be destroyed,
    but those who trust in the Lord will possess the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Soon the wicked will disappear.
    Though you look for them, they will be gone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lowly will possess the land
    and will live in peace and prosperity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked plot against the godly;
    they snarl at them in defiance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord just laughs,
    for he sees their day of judgment coming.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked draw their swords
    and string their bows
to kill the poor and the oppressed,
    to slaughter those who do right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But their swords will stab their own hearts,
    and their bows will be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to be godly and have little
    than to be evil and rich.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the strength of the wicked will be shattered,
    but the Lord takes care of the godly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day by day the Lord takes care of the innocent,
    and they will receive an inheritance that lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will not be disgraced in hard times;
    even in famine they will have more than enough.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the wicked will die.
    The Lord’s enemies are like flowers in a field—
    they will disappear like smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked borrow and never repay,
    but the godly are generous givers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those the Lord blesses will possess the land,
    but those he curses will die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord directs the steps of the godly.
    He delights in every detail of their lives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though they stumble, they will never fall,
    for the Lord holds them by the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Once I was young, and now I am old.
    Yet I have never seen the godly abandoned
    or their children begging for bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The godly always give generous loans to others,
    and their children are a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn from evil and do good,
    and you will live in the land forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord loves justice,
    and he will never abandon the godly.
He will keep them safe forever,
    but the children of the wicked will die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The godly will possess the land
    and will live there forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The godly offer good counsel;
    they teach right from wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have made God’s law their own,
    so they will never slip from his path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked wait in ambush for the godly,
    looking for an excuse to kill them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord will not let the wicked succeed
    or let the godly be condemned when they are put on trial.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put your hope in the Lord.
    Travel steadily along his path.
He will honor you by giving you the land.
    You will see the wicked destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen wicked and ruthless people
    flourishing like a tree in its native soil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But when I looked again, they were gone!
    Though I searched for them, I could not find them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look at those who are honest and good,
    for a wonderful future awaits those who love peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the rebellious will be destroyed;
    they have no future.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rescues the godly;
    he is their fortress in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord helps them,
    rescuing them from the wicked.
He saves them,
    and they find shelter in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, don’t rebuke me in your anger
    or discipline me in your rage!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your arrows have struck deep,
    and your blows are crushing me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of your anger, my whole body is sick;
    my health is broken because of my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My guilt overwhelms me—
    it is a burden too heavy to bear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My wounds fester and stink
    because of my foolish sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am bent over and racked with pain.
    All day long I walk around filled with grief.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A raging fever burns within me,
    and my health is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am exhausted and completely crushed.
    My groans come from an anguished heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You know what I long for, Lord;
    you hear my every sigh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart beats wildly, my strength fails,
    and I am going blind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My loved ones and friends stay away, fearing my disease.
    Even my own family stands at a distance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Meanwhile, my enemies lay traps to kill me.
    Those who wish me harm make plans to ruin me.
    All day long they plan their treachery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am deaf to all their threats.
    I am silent before them as one who cannot speak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I choose to hear nothing,
    and I make no reply.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am waiting for you, O Lord.
    You must answer for me, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I prayed, “Don’t let my enemies gloat over me
    or rejoice at my downfall.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am on the verge of collapse,
    facing constant pain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I confess my sins;
    I am deeply sorry for what I have done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have many aggressive enemies;
    they hate me without reason.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They repay me evil for good
    and oppose me for pursuing good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not abandon me, O Lord.
    Do not stand at a distance, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come quickly to help me,
    O Lord my savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said to myself, “I will watch what I do
    and not sin in what I say.
I will hold my tongue
    when the ungodly are around me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as I stood there in silence—
    not even speaking of good things—
    the turmoil within me grew worse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The more I thought about it,
    the hotter I got,
    igniting a fire of words:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Lord, remind me how brief my time on earth will be.
    Remind me that my days are numbered—
    how fleeting my life is.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
We are merely moving shadows,
    and all our busy rushing ends in nothing.
We heap up wealth,
    not knowing who will spend it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And so, Lord, where do I put my hope?
    My only hope is in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me from my rebellion.
    Do not let fools mock me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am silent before you; I won’t say a word,
    for my punishment is from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But please stop striking me!
    I am exhausted by the blows from your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you discipline us for our sins,
    you consume like a moth what is precious to us.
    Each of us is but a breath. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my prayer, O Lord!
    Listen to my cries for help!
    Don’t ignore my tears.
For I am your guest—
    a traveler passing through,
    as my ancestors were before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Leave me alone so I can smile again
    before I am gone and exist no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I waited patiently for the Lord to help me,
    and he turned to me and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He lifted me out of the pit of despair,
    out of the mud and the mire.
He set my feet on solid ground
    and steadied me as I walked along.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has given me a new song to sing,
    a hymn of praise to our God.
Many will see what he has done and be amazed.
    They will put their trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, the joys of those who trust the Lord,
    who have no confidence in the proud
    or in those who worship idols.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, you have performed many wonders for us.
    Your plans for us are too numerous to list.
    You have no equal.
If I tried to recite all your wonderful deeds,
    I would never come to the end of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You take no delight in sacrifices or offerings.
    Now that you have made me listen, I finally understand—
    you don’t require burnt offerings or sin offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, “Look, I have come.
    As is written about me in the Scriptures:
speaker: Narrator

text:
I take joy in doing your will, my God,
    for your instructions are written on my heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have told all your people about your justice.
    I have not been afraid to speak out,
    as you, O Lord, well know.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not kept the good news of your justice hidden in my heart;
    I have talked about your faithfulness and saving power.
I have told everyone in the great assembly
    of your unfailing love and faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, don’t hold back your tender mercies from me.
    Let your unfailing love and faithfulness always protect me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For troubles surround me—
    too many to count!
My sins pile up so high
    I can’t see my way out.
They outnumber the hairs on my head.
    I have lost all courage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Please, Lord, rescue me!
    Come quickly, Lord, and help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May those who try to destroy me
    be humiliated and put to shame.
May those who take delight in my trouble
    be turned back in disgrace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be horrified by their shame,
    for they said, “Aha! We’ve got him now!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But may all who search for you
    be filled with joy and gladness in you.
May those who love your salvation
    repeatedly shout, “The Lord is great!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, since I am poor and needy,
    let the Lord keep me in his thoughts.
You are my helper and my savior.
    O my God, do not delay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, the joys of those who are kind to the poor!
    The Lord rescues them when they are in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects them
    and keeps them alive.
He gives them prosperity in the land
    and rescues them from their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord nurses them when they are sick
    and restores them to health.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“O Lord,” I prayed, “have mercy on me.
    Heal me, for I have sinned against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But my enemies say nothing but evil about me.
    “How soon will he die and be forgotten?” they ask.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They visit me as if they were my friends,
    but all the while they gather gossip,
    and when they leave, they spread it everywhere.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who hate me whisper about me,
    imagining the worst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He has some fatal disease,” they say.
    “He will never get out of that bed!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even my best friend, the one I trusted completely,
    the one who shared my food, has turned against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, have mercy on me.
    Make me well again, so I can pay them back!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know you are pleased with me,
    for you have not let my enemies triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have preserved my life because I am innocent;
    you have brought me into your presence forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, the God of Israel,
    who lives from everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and amen!
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the deer longs for streams of water,
    so I long for you, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I thirst for God, the living God.
    When can I go and stand before him?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My heart is breaking
    as I remember how it used to be:
I walked among the crowds of worshipers,
    leading a great procession to the house of God,
singing for joy and giving thanks
    amid the sound of a great celebration!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why am I discouraged?
    Why is my heart so sad?
I will put my hope in God!
    I will praise him again—
    my Savior and
speaker: Narrator

text:
my God! 
Now I am deeply discouraged,
    but I will remember you—
even from distant Mount Hermon, the source of the Jordan,
    from the land of Mount Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hear the tumult of the raging seas
    as your waves and surging tides sweep over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But each day the Lord pours his unfailing love upon me,
    and through each night I sing his songs,
    praying to God who gives me life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“O God my rock,” I cry,
    “Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I wander around in grief,
    oppressed by my enemies?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their taunts break my bones.
    They scoff, “Where is this God of yours?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why am I discouraged?
    Why is my heart so sad?
I will put my hope in God!
    I will praise him again—
    my Savior and my God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare me innocent, O God!
    Defend me against these ungodly people.
    Rescue me from these unjust liars.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are God, my only safe haven.
    Why have you tossed me aside?
Why must I wander around in grief,
    oppressed by my enemies?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Send out your light and your truth;
    let them guide me.
Let them lead me to your holy mountain,
    to the place where you live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There I will go to the altar of God,
    to God—the source of all my joy.
I will praise you with my harp,
    O God, my God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why am I discouraged?
    Why is my heart so sad?
I will put my hope in God!
    I will praise him again—
    my Savior and my God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, we have heard it with our own ears—
    our ancestors have told us
of all you did in their day,
    in days long ago:
speaker: Narrator

text:
You drove out the pagan nations by your power
    and gave all the land to our ancestors.
You crushed their enemies
    and set our ancestors free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They did not conquer the land with their swords;
    it was not their own strong arm that gave them victory.
It was your right hand and strong arm
    and the blinding light from your face that helped them,
    for you loved them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my King and my God.
    You command victories for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Only by your power can we push back our enemies;
    only in your name can we trample our foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do not trust in my bow;
    I do not count on my sword to save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the one who gives us victory over our enemies;
    you disgrace those who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, we give glory to you all day long
    and constantly praise your name. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
But now you have tossed us aside in dishonor.
    You no longer lead our armies to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us retreat from our enemies
    and allow those who hate us to plunder our land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have butchered us like sheep
    and scattered us among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sold your precious people for a pittance,
    making nothing on the sale.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You let our neighbors mock us.
    We are an object of scorn and derision to those around us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made us the butt of their jokes;
    they shake their heads at us in scorn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We can’t escape the constant humiliation;
    shame is written across our faces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All we hear are the taunts of our mockers.
    All we see are our vengeful enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All this has happened though we have not forgotten you.
    We have not violated your covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our hearts have not deserted you.
    We have not strayed from your path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you have crushed us in the jackal’s desert home.
    You have covered us with darkness and death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If we had forgotten the name of our God
    or spread our hands in prayer to foreign gods,
speaker: Narrator

text:
God would surely have known it,
    for he knows the secrets of every heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But for your sake we are killed every day;
    we are being slaughtered like sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up, O Lord! Why do you sleep?
    Get up! Do not reject us forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you look the other way?
    Why do you ignore our suffering and oppression?
speaker: Narrator

text:
We collapse in the dust,
    lying face down in the dirt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up! Help us!
    Ransom us because of your unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beautiful words stir my heart.
    I will recite a lovely poem about the king,
    for my tongue is like the pen of a skillful poet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the most handsome of all.
    Gracious words stream from your lips.
    God himself has blessed you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put on your sword, O mighty warrior!
    You are so glorious, so majestic!
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your majesty, ride out to victory,
    defending truth, humility, and justice.
    Go forth to perform awe-inspiring deeds!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your arrows are sharp, piercing your enemies’ hearts.
    The nations fall beneath your feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your throne, O God, endures forever and ever.
    You rule with a scepter of justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You love justice and hate evil.
    Therefore God, your God, has anointed you,
    pouring out the oil of joy on you more than on anyone else.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Myrrh, aloes, and cassia perfume your robes.
    In ivory palaces the music of strings entertains you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kings’ daughters are among your noble women.
    At your right side stands the queen,
    wearing jewelry of finest gold from Ophir!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to me, O royal daughter; take to heart what I say.
    Forget your people and your family far away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your royal husband delights in your beauty;
    honor him, for he is your lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The princess of Tyre will shower you with gifts.
    The wealthy will beg your favor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The bride, a princess, looks glorious
    in her golden gown.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In her beautiful robes, she is led to the king,
    accompanied by her bridesmaids.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What a joyful and enthusiastic procession
    as they enter the king’s palace!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your sons will become kings like their father.
    You will make them rulers over many lands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bring honor to your name in every generation.
    Therefore, the nations will praise you forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is our refuge and strength,
    always ready to help in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So we will not fear when earthquakes come
    and the mountains crumble into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the oceans roar and foam.
    Let the mountains tremble as the waters surge! Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
A river brings joy to the city of our God,
    the sacred home of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
