    “They have all become citizens of Jerusalem.” Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people will play flutes and sing,
    “The source of my life springs from Jerusalem!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, God of my salvation,
    I cry out to you by day.
    I come to you at night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now hear my prayer;
    listen to my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my life is full of troubles,
    and death draws near.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am as good as dead,
    like a strong man with no strength left.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have left me among the dead,
    and I lie like a corpse in a grave.
I am forgotten,
    cut off from your care.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have thrown me into the lowest pit,
    into the darkest depths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your anger weighs me down;
    with wave after wave you have engulfed me. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have driven my friends away
    by making me repulsive to them.
I am in a trap with no way of escape.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Are your wonderful deeds of any use to the dead?
    Do the dead rise up and praise you? Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can those in the grave declare your unfailing love?
    Can they proclaim your faithfulness in the place of destruction?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can the darkness speak of your wonderful deeds?
    Can anyone in the land of forgetfulness talk about your righteousness?
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I cry out to you.
    I will keep on pleading day by day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, why do you reject me?
    Why do you turn your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have been sick and close to death since my youth.
    I stand helpless and desperate before your terrors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your fierce anger has overwhelmed me.
    Your terrors have paralyzed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They swirl around me like floodwaters all day long.
    They have engulfed me completely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have taken away my companions and loved ones.
    Darkness is my closest friend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing of the Lord’s unfailing love forever!
    Young and old will hear of your faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your unfailing love will last forever.
    Your faithfulness is as enduring as the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord said, “I have made a covenant with David, my chosen servant.
    I have sworn this oath to him:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘I will establish your descendants as kings forever;
    they will sit on your throne from now until eternity.’” Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
All heaven will praise your great wonders, Lord;
    myriads of angels will praise you for your faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For who in all of heaven can compare with the Lord?
    What mightiest angel is anything like the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The highest angelic powers stand in awe of God.
    He is far more awesome than all who surround his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord God of Heaven’s Armies!
    Where is there anyone as mighty as you, O Lord?
    You are entirely faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rule the oceans.
    You subdue their storm-tossed waves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You crushed the great sea monster.
    You scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens are yours, and the earth is yours;
    everything in the world is yours—you created it all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You created north and south.
    Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon praise your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Powerful is your arm!
    Strong is your hand!
    Your right hand is lifted high in glorious strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne.
    Unfailing love and truth walk before you as attendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy are those who hear the joyful call to worship,
    for they will walk in the light of your presence, Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They rejoice all day long in your wonderful reputation.
    They exult in your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are their glorious strength.
    It pleases you to make us strong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, our protection comes from the Lord,
    and he, the Holy One of Israel, has given us our king.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Long ago you spoke in a vision to your faithful people.
You said, “I have raised up a warrior.
    I have selected him from the common people to be king.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have found my servant David.
    I have anointed him with my holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will steady him with my hand;
    with my powerful arm I will make him strong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His enemies will not defeat him,
    nor will the wicked overpower him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will beat down his adversaries before him
    and destroy those who hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My faithfulness and unfailing love will be with him,
    and by my authority he will grow in power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will extend his rule over the sea,
    his dominion over the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he will call out to me, ‘You are my Father,
    my God, and the Rock of my salvation.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make him my firstborn son,
    the mightiest king on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will love him and be kind to him forever;
    my covenant with him will never end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will preserve an heir for him;
    his throne will be as endless as the days of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But if his descendants forsake my instructions
    and fail to obey my regulations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if they do not obey my decrees
    and fail to keep my commands,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then I will punish their sin with the rod,
    and their disobedience with beating.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will never stop loving him
    nor fail to keep my promise to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No, I will not break my covenant;
    I will not take back a single word I said.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have sworn an oath to David,
    and in my holiness I cannot lie:
speaker: Narrator

text:
His dynasty will go on forever;
    his kingdom will endure as the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will be as eternal as the moon,
    my faithful witness in the sky!” Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
But now you have rejected him and cast him off.
    You are angry with your anointed king.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have renounced your covenant with him;
    you have thrown his crown in the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have broken down the walls protecting him
    and ruined every fort defending him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone who comes along has robbed him,
    and he has become a joke to his neighbors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have strengthened his enemies
    and made them all rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made his sword useless
    and refused to help him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have ended his splendor
    and overturned his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made him old before his time
    and publicly disgraced him. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, how long will this go on?
    Will you hide yourself forever?
    How long will your anger burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember how short my life is,
    how empty and futile this human existence!
speaker: Narrator

text:
No one can live forever; all will die.
    No one can escape the power of the grave. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, where is your unfailing love?
    You promised it to David with a faithful pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider, Lord, how your servants are disgraced!
    I carry in my heart the insults of so many people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your enemies have mocked me, O Lord;
    they mock your anointed king wherever he goes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord forever!
    Amen and amen!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, through all the generations
    you have been our home!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before the mountains were born,
    before you gave birth to the earth and the world,
    from beginning to end, you are God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You turn people back to dust, saying,
    “Return to dust, you mortals!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, a thousand years are as a passing day,
    as brief as a few night hours.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sweep people away like dreams that disappear.
    They are like grass that springs up in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the morning it blooms and flourishes,
    but by evening it is dry and withered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We wither beneath your anger;
    we are overwhelmed by your fury.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You spread out our sins before you—
    our secret sins—and you see them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We live our lives beneath your wrath,
    ending our years with a groan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seventy years are given to us!
    Some even live to eighty.
But even the best years are filled with pain and trouble;
    soon they disappear, and we fly away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can comprehend the power of your anger?
    Your wrath is as awesome as the fear you deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach us to realize the brevity of life,
    so that we may grow in wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, come back to us!
    How long will you delay?
    Take pity on your servants!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Satisfy us each morning with your unfailing love,
    so we may sing for joy to the end of our lives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give us gladness in proportion to our former misery!
    Replace the evil years with good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let us, your servants, see you work again;
    let our children see your glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And may the Lord our God show us his approval
    and make our efforts successful.
    Yes, make our efforts successful!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who live in the shelter of the Most High
    will find rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For he will rescue you from every trap
    and protect you from deadly disease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will cover you with his feathers.
    He will shelter you with his wings.
    His faithful promises are your armor and protection.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be afraid of the terrors of the night,
    nor the arrow that flies in the day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not dread the disease that stalks in darkness,
    nor the disaster that strikes at midday.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though a thousand fall at your side,
    though ten thousand are dying around you,
    these evils will not touch you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Just open your eyes,
    and see how the wicked are punished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you make the Lord your refuge,
    if you make the Most High your shelter,
speaker: Narrator

text:
no evil will conquer you;
    no plague will come near your home.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will order his angels
    to protect you wherever you go.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will hold you up with their hands
    so you won’t even hurt your foot on a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will trample upon lions and cobras;
    you will crush fierce lions and serpents under your feet!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord says, “I will rescue those who love me.
    I will protect those who trust in my name.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will reward them with a long life
    and give them my salvation.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is good to give thanks to the Lord,
    to sing praises to the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is good to proclaim your unfailing love in the morning,
    your faithfulness in the evening,
speaker: Narrator

text:
accompanied by a ten-stringed instrument, a harp,
    and the melody of a lyre.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You thrill me, Lord, with all you have done for me!
    I sing for joy because of what you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, what great works you do!
    And how deep are your thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Only a simpleton would not know,
    and only a fool would not understand this:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though the wicked sprout like weeds
    and evildoers flourish,
    they will be destroyed forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, O Lord, will be exalted forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your enemies, Lord, will surely perish;
    all evildoers will be scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have made me as strong as a wild ox.
    You have anointed me with the finest oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes have seen the downfall of my enemies;
    my ears have heard the defeat of my wicked opponents.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the godly will flourish like palm trees
    and grow strong like the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they are transplanted to the Lord’s own house.
    They flourish in the courts of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even in old age they will still produce fruit;
    they will remain vital and green.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will declare, “The Lord is just!
    He is my rock!
    There is no evil in him!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is king! He is robed in majesty.
    Indeed, the Lord is robed in majesty and armed with strength.
The world stands firm
    and cannot be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your throne, O Lord, has stood from time immemorial.
    You yourself are from the everlasting past.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But mightier than the violent raging of the seas,
    mightier than the breakers on the shore—
    the Lord above is mightier than these!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your royal laws cannot be changed.
    Your reign, O Lord, is holy forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, the God of vengeance,
    O God of vengeance, let your glorious justice shine forth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Judge of the earth.
    Give the proud what they deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord?
    How long will the wicked be allowed to gloat?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long will they speak with arrogance?
    How long will these evil people boast?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They crush your people, Lord,
    hurting those you claim as your own.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They kill widows and foreigners
    and murder orphans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The Lord isn’t looking,” they say,
    “and besides, the God of Israel doesn’t care.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Think again, you fools!
    When will you finally catch on?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is he deaf—the one who made your ears?
    Is he blind—the one who formed your eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He punishes the nations—won’t he also punish you?
    He knows everything—doesn’t he also know what you are doing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord knows people’s thoughts;
    he knows they are worthless!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joyful are those you discipline, Lord,
    those you teach with your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You give them relief from troubled times
    until a pit is dug to capture the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will not reject his people;
    he will not abandon his special possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judgment will again be founded on justice,
    and those with virtuous hearts will pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will protect me from the wicked?
    Who will stand up for me against evildoers?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Unless the Lord had helped me,
    I would soon have settled in the silence of the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried out, “I am slipping!”
    but your unfailing love, O Lord, supported me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When doubts filled my mind,
    your comfort gave me renewed hope and cheer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can unjust leaders claim that God is on their side—
    leaders whose decrees permit injustice?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They gang up against the righteous
    and condemn the innocent to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord is my fortress;
    my God is the mighty rock where I hide.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God will turn the sins of evil people back on them.
    He will destroy them for their sins.
    The Lord our God will destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let us sing to the Lord!
    Let us shout joyfully to the Rock of our salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let us come to him with thanksgiving.
    Let us sing psalms of praise to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is a great God,
    a great King above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He holds in his hands the depths of the earth
    and the mightiest mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea belongs to him, for he made it.
    His hands formed the dry land, too.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let us worship and bow down.
    Let us kneel before the Lord our maker,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for he is our God.
We are the people he watches over,
    the flock under his care.
If only you would listen to his voice today!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord says, “Don’t harden your hearts as Israel did at Meribah,
    as they did at Massah in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there your ancestors tested and tried my patience,
    even though they saw everything I did.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For forty years I was angry with them, and I said,
‘They are a people whose hearts turn away from me.
    They refuse to do what I tell them.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
So in my anger I took an oath:
    ‘They will never enter my place of rest.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing a new song to the Lord!
    Let the whole earth sing to the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord; praise his name.
    Each day proclaim the good news that he saves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Publish his glorious deeds among the nations.
    Tell everyone about the amazing things he does.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is the Lord! He is most worthy of praise!
    He is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The gods of other nations are mere idols,
    but the Lord made the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor and majesty surround him;
    strength and beauty fill his sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O nations of the world, recognize the Lord;
    recognize that the Lord is glorious and strong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give to the Lord the glory he deserves!
    Bring your offering and come into his courts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Worship the Lord in all his holy splendor.
    Let all the earth tremble before him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell all the nations, “The Lord reigns!”
    The world stands firm and cannot be shaken.
    He will judge all peoples fairly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens be glad, and the earth rejoice!
    Let the sea and everything in it shout his praise!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the fields and their crops burst out with joy!
    Let the trees of the forest sing for joy
speaker: Narrator

text:
before the Lord, for he is coming!
    He is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with justice,
    and the nations with his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is king!
    Let the earth rejoice!
    Let the farthest coastlands be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Dark clouds surround him.
    Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire spreads ahead of him
    and burns up all his foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His lightning flashes out across the world.
    The earth sees and trembles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains melt like wax before the Lord,
    before the Lord of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens proclaim his righteousness;
    every nation sees his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who worship idols are disgraced—
    all who brag about their worthless gods—
    for every god must bow to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jerusalem has heard and rejoiced,
    and all the towns of Judah are glad
    because of your justice, O Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, O Lord, are supreme over all the earth;
    you are exalted far above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who love the Lord, hate evil!
    He protects the lives of his godly people
    and rescues them from the power of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Light shines on the godly,
    and joy on those whose hearts are right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all who are godly rejoice in the Lord
    and praise his holy name!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing a new song to the Lord,
    for he has done wonderful deeds.
His right hand has won a mighty victory;
    his holy arm has shown his saving power!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has announced his victory
    and has revealed his righteousness to every nation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has remembered his promise to love and be faithful to Israel.
    The ends of the earth have seen the victory of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shout to the Lord, all the earth;
    break out in praise and sing for joy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing your praise to the Lord with the harp,
    with the harp and melodious song,
speaker: Narrator

text:
with trumpets and the sound of the ram’s horn.
    Make a joyful symphony before the Lord, the King!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea and everything in it shout his praise!
    Let the earth and all living things join in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the rivers clap their hands in glee!
    Let the hills sing out their songs of joy
speaker: Narrator

text:
before the Lord,
    for he is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with justice,
    and the nations with fairness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is king!
    Let the nations tremble!
He sits on his throne between the cherubim.
    Let the whole earth quake!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord sits in majesty in Jerusalem,
    exalted above all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise your great and awesome name.
    Your name is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mighty King, lover of justice,
    you have established fairness.
You have acted with justice
    and righteousness throughout Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Exalt the Lord our God!
    Bow low before his feet, for he is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moses and Aaron were among his priests;
    Samuel also called on his name.
They cried to the Lord for help,
    and he answered them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke to Israel from the pillar of cloud,
    and they followed the laws and decrees he gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord our God, you answered them.
    You were a forgiving God to them,
    but you punished them when they went wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Exalt the Lord our God,
    and worship at his holy mountain in Jerusalem,
    for the Lord our God is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Shout with joy to the Lord, all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Worship the Lord with gladness.
    Come before him, singing with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Acknowledge that the Lord is God!
    He made us, and we are his.
    We are his people, the sheep of his pasture.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the Lord is good.
    His unfailing love continues forever,
    and his faithfulness continues to each generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing of your love and justice, Lord.
    I will praise you with songs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be careful to live a blameless life—
    when will you come to help me?
I will lead a life of integrity
    in my own home.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will refuse to look at
    anything vile and vulgar.
I hate all who deal crookedly;
    I will have nothing to do with them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will reject perverse ideas
    and stay away from every evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not tolerate people who slander their neighbors.
    I will not endure conceit and pride.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will search for faithful people
    to be my companions.
Only those who are above reproach
    will be allowed to serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not allow deceivers to serve in my house,
    and liars will not stay in my presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My daily task will be to ferret out the wicked
    and free the city of the Lord from their grip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, hear my prayer!
    Listen to my plea!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t turn away from me
    in my time of distress.
Bend down to listen,
    and answer me quickly when I call to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my days disappear like smoke,
    and my bones burn like red-hot coals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is sick, withered like grass,
    and I have lost my appetite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of my groaning,
    I am reduced to skin and bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am like an owl in the desert,
    like a little owl in a far-off wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lie awake,
    lonely as a solitary bird on the roof.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies taunt me day after day.
    They mock and curse me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I eat ashes for food.
    My tears run down into my drink
speaker: Narrator

text:
because of your anger and wrath.
    For you have picked me up and thrown me out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My life passes as swiftly as the evening shadows.
    I am withering away like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, will sit on your throne forever.
    Your fame will endure to every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will arise and have mercy on Jerusalem—
    and now is the time to pity her,
    now is the time you promised to help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your people love every stone in her walls
    and cherish even the dust in her streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the nations will tremble before the Lord.
    The kings of the earth will tremble before his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will rebuild Jerusalem.
    He will appear in his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will listen to the prayers of the destitute.
    He will not reject their pleas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let this be recorded for future generations,
    so that a people not yet born will praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell them the Lord looked down
    from his heavenly sanctuary.
He looked down to earth from heaven
speaker: Narrator

text:
to hear the groans of the prisoners,
    to release those condemned to die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And so the Lord’s fame will be celebrated in Zion,
    his praises in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when multitudes gather together
    and kingdoms come to worship the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He broke my strength in midlife,
    cutting short my days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I cried to him, “O my God, who lives forever,
    don’t take my life while I am so young!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth
    and made the heavens with your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will perish, but you remain forever;
    they will wear out like old clothing.
You will change them like a garment
    and discard them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you are always the same;
    you will live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of your people
    will live in security.
Their children’s children
    will thrive in your presence.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all that I am praise the Lord;
    with my whole heart, I will praise his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all that I am praise the Lord;
    may I never forget the good things he does for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He forgives all my sins
    and heals all my diseases.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He redeems me from death
    and crowns me with love and tender mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He fills my life with good things.
    My youth is renewed like the eagle’s!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord gives righteousness
    and justice to all who are treated unfairly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He revealed his character to Moses
    and his deeds to the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is compassionate and merciful,
    slow to get angry and filled with unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not constantly accuse us,
    nor remain angry forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He does not punish us for all our sins;
    he does not deal harshly with us, as we deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For his unfailing love toward those who fear him
    is as great as the height of the heavens above the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has removed our sins as far from us
    as the east is from the west.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is like a father to his children,
    tender and compassionate to those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he knows how weak we are;
    he remembers we are only dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our days on earth are like grass;
    like wildflowers, we bloom and die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wind blows, and we are gone—
    as though we had never been here.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the love of the Lord remains forever
    with those who fear him.
His salvation extends to the children’s children
speaker: Narrator

text:
of those who are faithful to his covenant,
    of those who obey his commandments!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has made the heavens his throne;
    from there he rules over everything.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, you angels,
    you mighty ones who carry out his plans,
    listening for each of his commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, praise the Lord, you armies of angels
    who serve him and do his will!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, everything he has created,
    everything in all his kingdom.
Let all that I am praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all that I am praise the Lord.
O Lord my God, how great you are!
    You are robed with honor and majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are dressed in a robe of light.
You stretch out the starry curtain of the heavens;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The winds are your messengers;
    flames of fire are your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You placed the world on its foundation
    so it would never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You clothed the earth with floods of water,
    water that covered even the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At your command, the water fled;
    at the sound of your thunder, it hurried away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mountains rose and valleys sank
    to the levels you decreed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you set a firm boundary for the seas,
    so they would never again cover the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make springs pour water into the ravines,
    so streams gush down from the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They provide water for all the animals,
    and the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The birds nest beside the streams
    and sing among the branches of the trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You send rain on the mountains from your heavenly home,
    and you fill the earth with the fruit of your labor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You cause grass to grow for the livestock
    and plants for people to use.
You allow them to produce food from the earth—
speaker: Narrator

text:
wine to make them glad,
olive oil to soothe their skin,
    and bread to give them strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The trees of the Lord are well cared for—
    the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There the birds make their nests,
    and the storks make their homes in the cypresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
High in the mountains live the wild goats,
    and the rocks form a refuge for the hyraxes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made the moon to mark the seasons,
    and the sun knows when to set.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You send the darkness, and it becomes night,
    when all the forest animals prowl about.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the young lions roar for their prey,
    stalking the food provided by God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At dawn they slink back
    into their dens to rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then people go off to their work,
    where they labor until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, what a variety of things you have made!
    In wisdom you have made them all.
    The earth is full of your creatures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Here is the ocean, vast and wide,
    teeming with life of every kind,
    both large and small.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See the ships sailing along,
    and Leviathan, which you made to play in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They all depend on you
    to give them food as they need it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you supply it, they gather it.
    You open your hand to feed them,
    and they are richly satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But if you turn away from them, they panic.
    When you take away their breath,
    they die and turn again to dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you give them your breath, life is created,
    and you renew the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the glory of the Lord continue forever!
    The Lord takes pleasure in all he has made!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth trembles at his glance;
    the mountains smoke at his touch.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live.
    I will praise my God to my last breath!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all my thoughts be pleasing to him,
    for I rejoice in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all sinners vanish from the face of the earth;
    let the wicked disappear forever.
Let all that I am praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord and proclaim his greatness.
    Let the whole world know what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him; yes, sing his praises.
    Tell everyone about his wonderful deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Exult in his holy name;
    rejoice, you who worship the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Search for the Lord and for his strength;
    continually seek him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember the wonders he has performed,
    his miracles, and the rulings he has given,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you children of his servant Abraham,
    you descendants of Jacob, his chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God.
    His justice is seen throughout the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He always stands by his covenant—
    the commitment he made to a thousand generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the covenant he made with Abraham
    and the oath he swore to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree,
    and to the people of Israel as a never-ending covenant:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will give you the land of Canaan
    as your special possession.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said this when they were few in number,
    a tiny group of strangers in Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They wandered from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet he did not let anyone oppress them.
    He warned kings on their behalf:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not touch my chosen people,
    and do not hurt my prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He called for a famine on the land of Canaan,
    cutting off its food supply.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he sent someone to Egypt ahead of them—
    Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They bruised his feet with fetters
    and placed his neck in an iron collar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Until the time came to fulfill his dreams,
    the Lord tested Joseph’s character.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Pharaoh sent for him and set him free;
    the ruler of the nation opened his prison door.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joseph was put in charge of all the king’s household;
    he became ruler over all the king’s possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He could instruct the king’s aides as he pleased
    and teach the king’s advisers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Israel arrived in Egypt;
    Jacob lived as a foreigner in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Lord multiplied the people of Israel
    until they became too mighty for their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he turned the Egyptians against the Israelites,
    and they plotted against the Lord’s servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord sent his servant Moses,
    along with Aaron, whom he had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They performed miraculous signs among the Egyptians,
    and wonders in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord blanketed Egypt in darkness,
    for they had defied his commands to let his people go.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their water into blood,
    poisoning all the fish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then frogs overran the land
    and even invaded the king’s bedrooms.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Lord spoke, flies descended on the Egyptians,
    and gnats swarmed across Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent them hail instead of rain,
    and lightning flashed over the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He ruined their grapevines and fig trees
    and shattered all the trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and hordes of locusts came—
    young locusts beyond number.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They ate up everything green in the land,
    destroying all the crops in their fields.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he killed the oldest son in each Egyptian home,
    the pride and joy of each family.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord brought his people out of Egypt, loaded with silver and gold;
    and not one among the tribes of Israel even stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt was glad when they were gone,
    for they feared them greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord spread a cloud above them as a covering
    and gave them a great fire to light the darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked for meat, and he sent them quail;
    he satisfied their hunger with manna—bread from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He split open a rock, and water gushed out
    to form a river through the dry wasteland.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he remembered his sacred promise
    to his servant Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he brought his people out of Egypt with joy,
    his chosen ones with rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave his people the lands of pagan nations,
    and they harvested crops that others had planted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All this happened so they would follow his decrees
    and obey his instructions.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good!
    His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can list the glorious miracles of the Lord?
    Who can ever praise him enough?
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is joy for those who deal justly with others
    and always do what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember me, Lord, when you show favor to your people;
    come near and rescue me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Like our ancestors, we have sinned.
    We have done wrong! We have acted wickedly!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our ancestors in Egypt
    were not impressed by the Lord’s miraculous deeds.
They soon forgot his many acts of kindness to them.
    Instead, they rebelled against him at the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even so, he saved them—
    to defend the honor of his name
    and to demonstrate his mighty power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He commanded the Red Sea to dry up.
    He led Israel across the sea as if it were a desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he rescued them from their enemies
    and redeemed them from their foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the water returned and covered their enemies;
    not one of them survived.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then his people believed his promises.
    Then they sang his praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet how quickly they forgot what he had done!
    They wouldn’t wait for his counsel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the wilderness their desires ran wild,
    testing God’s patience in that dry wasteland.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he gave them what they asked for,
    but he sent a plague along with it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people in the camp were jealous of Moses
    and envious of Aaron, the Lord’s holy priest.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Fire fell upon their followers;
    a flame consumed the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people made a calf at Mount Sinai;
    they bowed before an image made of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They traded their glorious God
    for a statue of a grass-eating bull.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They forgot God, their savior,
    who had done such great things in Egypt—
speaker: Narrator

text:
such wonderful things in the land of Ham,
    such awesome deeds at the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he declared he would destroy them.
    But Moses, his chosen one, stepped between the Lord and the people.
    He begged him to turn from his anger and not destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people refused to enter the pleasant land,
    for they wouldn’t believe his promise to care for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, they grumbled in their tents
    and refused to obey the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, he solemnly swore
    that he would kill them in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that he would scatter their descendants among the nations,
    exiling them to distant lands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then our ancestors joined in the worship of Baal at Peor;
    they even ate sacrifices offered to the dead!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They angered the Lord with all these things,
    so a plague broke out among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Phinehas had the courage to intervene,
    and the plague was stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he has been regarded as a righteous man
    ever since that time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At Meribah, too, they angered the Lord,
    causing Moses serious trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made Moses angry,
    and he spoke foolishly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel failed to destroy the nations in the land,
    as the Lord had commanded them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, they mingled among the pagans
    and adopted their evil customs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They worshiped their idols,
    which led to their downfall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They even sacrificed their sons
    and their daughters to the demons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shed innocent blood,
    the blood of their sons and daughters.
By sacrificing them to the idols of Canaan,
    they polluted the land with murder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They defiled themselves by their evil deeds,
    and their love of idols was adultery in the Lord’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why the Lord’s anger burned against his people,
    and he abhorred his own special possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He handed them over to pagan nations,
    and they were ruled by those who hated them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their enemies crushed them
    and brought them under their cruel power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Again and again he rescued them,
    but they chose to rebel against him,
    and they were finally destroyed by their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even so, he pitied them in their distress
    and listened to their cries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembered his covenant with them
    and relented because of his unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He even caused their captors
    to treat them with kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save us, O Lord our God!
    Gather us back from among the nations,
so we can thank your holy name
    and rejoice and praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, the God of Israel,
    who lives from everlasting to everlasting!
Let all the people say, “Amen!”
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good!
    His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Has the Lord redeemed you? Then speak out!
    Tell others he has redeemed you from your enemies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Some wandered in the wilderness,
    lost and homeless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hungry and thirsty,
    they nearly died.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Lord, help!” they cried in their trouble,
    and he rescued them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led them straight to safety,
    to a city where they could live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise the Lord for his great love
    and for the wonderful things he has done for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he satisfies the thirsty
    and fills the hungry with good things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some sat in darkness and deepest gloom,
    imprisoned in iron chains of misery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They rebelled against the words of God,
    scorning the counsel of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why he broke them with hard labor;
    they fell, and no one was there to help them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Lord, help!” they cried in their trouble,
    and he saved them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led them from the darkness and deepest gloom;
    he snapped their chains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise the Lord for his great love
    and for the wonderful things he has done for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he broke down their prison gates of bronze;
    he cut apart their bars of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some were fools; they rebelled
    and suffered for their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They couldn’t stand the thought of food,
    and they were knocking on death’s door.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Lord, help!” they cried in their trouble,
    and he saved them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent out his word and healed them,
    snatching them from the door of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise the Lord for his great love
    and for the wonderful things he has done for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving
    and sing joyfully about his glorious acts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some went off to sea in ships,
    plying the trade routes of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They, too, observed the Lord’s power in action,
    his impressive works on the deepest seas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and the winds rose,
    stirring up the waves.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They reeled and staggered like drunkards
    and were at their wits’ end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Lord, help!” they cried in their trouble,
    and he saved them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He calmed the storm to a whisper
    and stilled the waves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What a blessing was that stillness
    as he brought them safely into harbor!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise the Lord for his great love
    and for the wonderful things he has done for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them exalt him publicly before the congregation
    and before the leaders of the nation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He changes rivers into deserts,
    and springs of water into dry, thirsty land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turns the fruitful land into salty wastelands,
    because of the wickedness of those who live there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he also turns deserts into pools of water,
    the dry land into springs of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brings the hungry to settle there
    and to build their cities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They sow their fields, plant their vineyards,
    and harvest their bumper crops.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How he blesses them!
    They raise large families there,
    and their herds of livestock increase.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they decrease in number and become impoverished
    through oppression, trouble, and sorrow,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the Lord pours contempt on their princes,
    causing them to wander in trackless wastelands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he rescues the poor from trouble
    and increases their families like flocks of sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The godly will see these things and be glad,
    while the wicked are struck silent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who are wise will take all this to heart;
    they will see in our history the faithful love of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is confident in you, O God;
    no wonder I can sing your praises with all my heart!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up, lyre and harp!
    I will wake the dawn with my song.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will thank you, Lord, among all the people.
    I will sing your praises among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your unfailing love is higher than the heavens.
    Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, O God, above the highest heavens.
    May your glory shine over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now rescue your beloved people.
    Answer and save us by your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has promised this by his holiness:
“I will divide up Shechem with joy.
    I will measure out the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gilead is mine,
    and Manasseh, too.
Ephraim, my helmet, will produce my warriors,
    and Judah, my scepter, will produce my kings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Moab, my washbasin, will become my servant,
    and I will wipe my feet on Edom
    and shout in triumph over Philistia.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
    Who will bring me victory over Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you rejected us, O God?
    Will you no longer march with our armies?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, please help us against our enemies,
    for all human help is useless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With God’s help we will do mighty things,
    for he will trample down our foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, whom I praise,
    don’t stand silent and aloof
speaker: Narrator

text:
while the wicked slander me
    and tell lies about me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surround me with hateful words
    and fight against me for no reason.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love them, but they try to destroy me with accusations
    even as I am praying for them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They repay evil for good,
    and hatred for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say, “Get an evil person to turn against him.
    Send an accuser to bring him to trial.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When his case comes up for judgment,
    let him be pronounced guilty.
    Count his prayers as sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his years be few;
    let someone else take his position.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his children become fatherless,
    and his wife a widow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his children wander as beggars
    and be driven from their ruined homes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May creditors seize his entire estate,
    and strangers take all he has earned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let no one be kind to him;
    let no one pity his fatherless children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all his offspring die.
    May his family name be blotted out in the next generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord never forget the sins of his fathers;
    may his mother’s sins never be erased from the record.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord always remember these sins,
    and may his name disappear from human memory.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Cursing is as natural to him as his clothing,
    or the water he drinks,
    or the rich food he eats.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now may his curses return and cling to him like clothing;
    may they be tied around him like a belt.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
May those curses become the Lord’s punishment
    for my accusers who speak evil of me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But deal well with me, O Sovereign Lord,
    for the sake of your own reputation!
Rescue me
    because you are so faithful and good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am poor and needy,
    and my heart is full of pain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am fading like a shadow at dusk;
    I am brushed off like a locust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My knees are weak from fasting,
    and I am skin and bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a joke to people everywhere;
    when they see me, they shake their heads in scorn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me, O Lord my God!
    Save me because of your unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them see that this is your doing,
    that you yourself have done it, Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then let them curse me if they like,
    but you will bless me!
When they attack me, they will be disgraced!
    But I, your servant, will go right on rejoicing!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my accusers be clothed with disgrace;
    may their humiliation cover them like a cloak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will give repeated thanks to the Lord,
    praising him to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he stands beside the needy,
    ready to save them from those who condemn them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit in the place of honor at my right hand
until I humble your enemies,
    making them a footstool under your feet.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will extend your powerful kingdom from Jerusalem;
    you will rule over your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you go to war,
    your people will serve you willingly.
You are arrayed in holy garments,
    and your strength will be renewed each day like the morning dew.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has taken an oath and will not break his vow:
    “You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord stands at your right hand to protect you.
    He will strike down many kings when his anger erupts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But he himself will be refreshed from brooks along the way.
    He will be victorious.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
I will thank the Lord with all my heart
    as I meet with his godly people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How amazing are the deeds of the Lord!
    All who delight in him should ponder them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everything he does reveals his glory and majesty.
    His righteousness never fails.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He causes us to remember his wonderful works.
    How gracious and merciful is our Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives food to those who fear him;
    he always remembers his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has shown his great power to his people
    by giving them the lands of other nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All he does is just and good,
    and all his commandments are trustworthy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are forever true,
    to be obeyed faithfully and with integrity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has paid a full ransom for his people.
    He has guaranteed his covenant with them forever.
    What a holy, awe-inspiring name he has!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fear of the Lord is the foundation of true wisdom.
    All who obey his commandments will grow in wisdom.
Praise him forever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
How joyful are those who fear the Lord
    and delight in obeying his commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their children will be successful everywhere;
    an entire generation of godly people will be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They themselves will be wealthy,
    and their good deeds will last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Light shines in the darkness for the godly.
    They are generous, compassionate, and righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Good comes to those who lend money generously
    and conduct their business fairly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Such people will not be overcome by evil.
    Those who are righteous will be long remembered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They do not fear bad news;
    they confidently trust the Lord to care for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are confident and fearless
    and can face their foes triumphantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They share freely and give generously to those in need.
    Their good deeds will be remembered forever.
    They will have influence and honor.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Yes, give praise, O servants of the Lord.
    Praise the name of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the name of the Lord
    now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everywhere—from east to west—
    praise the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is high above the nations;
    his glory is higher than the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can be compared with the Lord our God,
    who is enthroned on high?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He stoops to look down
    on heaven and on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He lifts the poor from the dust
    and the needy from the garbage dump.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sets them among princes,
    even the princes of his own people!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives the childless woman a family,
    making her a happy mother.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Israelites escaped from Egypt—
    when the family of Jacob left that foreign land—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the land of Judah became God’s sanctuary,
    and Israel became his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Red Sea saw them coming and hurried out of their way!
    The water of the Jordan River turned away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
    the hills like lambs!
speaker: Narrator

text:
What’s wrong, Red Sea, that made you hurry out of their way?
    What happened, Jordan River, that you turned away?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why, mountains, did you skip like rams?
    Why, hills, like lambs?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
    at the presence of the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned the rock into a pool of water;
    yes, a spring of water flowed from solid rock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Not to us, O Lord, not to us,
    but to your name goes all the glory
    for your unfailing love and faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why let the nations say,
    “Where is their God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our God is in the heavens,
    and he does as he wishes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their idols are merely things of silver and gold,
    shaped by human hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths but cannot speak,
    and eyes but cannot see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears but cannot hear,
    and noses but cannot smell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have hands but cannot feel,
    and feet but cannot walk,
    and throats but cannot make a sound.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And those who make idols are just like them,
    as are all who trust in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, trust the Lord!
    He is your helper and your shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O priests, descendants of Aaron, trust the Lord!
    He is your helper and your shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All you who fear the Lord, trust the Lord!
    He is your helper and your shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord remembers us and will bless us.
    He will bless the people of Israel
    and bless the priests, the descendants of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will bless those who fear the Lord,
    both great and lowly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord richly bless
    both you and your children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May you be blessed by the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens belong to the Lord,
    but he has given the earth to all humanity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The dead cannot sing praises to the Lord,
    for they have gone into the silence of the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But we can praise the Lord
    both now and forever!
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love the Lord because he hears my voice
    and my prayer for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because he bends down to listen,
    I will pray as long as I have breath!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then I called on the name of the Lord:
    “Please, Lord, save me!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
How kind the Lord is! How good he is!
    So merciful, this God of ours!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects those of childlike faith;
    I was facing death, and he saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my soul be at rest again,
    for the Lord has been good to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has saved me from death,
    my eyes from tears,
    my feet from stumbling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And so I walk in the Lord’s presence
    as I live here on earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I believed in you, so I said,
    “I am deeply troubled, Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my anxiety I cried out to you,
    “These people are all liars!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
What can I offer the Lord
    for all he has done for me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lift up the cup of salvation
    and praise the Lord’s name for saving me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will keep my promises to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord cares deeply
    when his loved ones die.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will offer you a sacrifice of thanksgiving
    and call on the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will fulfill my vows to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people—
speaker: Narrator

text:
in the house of the Lord
    in the heart of Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all you nations.
    Praise him, all you people of the earth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good!
    His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all Israel repeat:
    “His faithful love endures forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Aaron’s descendants, the priests, repeat:
    “His faithful love endures forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all who fear the Lord repeat:
    “His faithful love endures forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my distress I prayed to the Lord,
    and the Lord answered me and set me free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is for me, so I will have no fear.
    What can mere people do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, the Lord is for me; he will help me.
    I will look in triumph at those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though hostile nations surrounded me,
    I destroyed them all with the authority of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, they surrounded and attacked me,
    but I destroyed them all with the authority of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My enemies did their best to kill me,
    but the Lord rescued me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my strength and my song;
    he has given me victory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Songs of joy and victory are sung in the camp of the godly.
    The strong right arm of the Lord has done glorious things!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The strong right arm of the Lord is raised in triumph.
    The strong right arm of the Lord has done glorious things!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not die; instead, I will live
    to tell what the Lord has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has punished me severely,
    but he did not let me die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open for me the gates where the righteous enter,
    and I will go in and thank the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These gates lead to the presence of the Lord,
    and the godly enter there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I thank you for answering my prayer
    and giving me victory!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The stone that the builders rejected
    has now become the cornerstone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the Lord’s doing,
    and it is wonderful to see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the day the Lord has made.
    We will rejoice and be glad in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Please, Lord, please save us.
    Please, Lord, please give us success.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    We bless you from the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is God, shining upon us.
    Take the sacrifice and bind it with cords on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my God, and I will praise you!
    You are my God, and I will exalt you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good!
    His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joyful are people of integrity,
    who follow the instructions of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joyful are those who obey his laws
    and search for him with all their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They do not compromise with evil,
    and they walk only in his paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have charged us
    to keep your commandments carefully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, that my actions would consistently
    reflect your decrees!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will not be ashamed
    when I compare my life with your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As I learn your righteous regulations,
    I will thank you by living as I should!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will obey your decrees.
    Please don’t give up on me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can a young person stay pure?
    By obeying your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have tried hard to find you—
    don’t let me wander from your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have hidden your word in my heart,
    that I might not sin against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I praise you, O Lord;
    teach me your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have recited aloud
    all the regulations you have given us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have rejoiced in your laws
    as much as in riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will study your commandments
    and reflect on your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will delight in your decrees
    and not forget your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be good to your servant,
    that I may live and obey your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open my eyes to see
    the wonderful truths in your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am only a foreigner in the land.
    Don’t hide your commands from me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am always overwhelmed
    with a desire for your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rebuke the arrogant;
    those who wander from your commands are cursed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let them scorn and insult me,
    for I have obeyed your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even princes sit and speak against me,
    but I will meditate on your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws please me;
    they give me wise advice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lie in the dust;
    revive me by your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I told you my plans, and you answered.
    Now teach me your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me understand the meaning of your commandments,
    and I will meditate on your wonderful deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I weep with sorrow;
    encourage me by your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me from lying to myself;
    give me the privilege of knowing your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have chosen to be faithful;
    I have determined to live by your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cling to your laws.
    Lord, don’t let me be put to shame!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will pursue your commands,
    for you expand my understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me your decrees, O Lord;
    I will keep them to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me understanding and I will obey your instructions;
    I will put them into practice with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make me walk along the path of your commands,
    for that is where my happiness is found.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me an eagerness for your laws
    rather than a love for money!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn my eyes from worthless things,
    and give me life through your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Reassure me of your promise,
    made to those who fear you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me abandon my shameful ways;
    for your regulations are good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I long to obey your commandments!
    Renew my life with your goodness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, give me your unfailing love,
    the salvation that you promised me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I can answer those who taunt me,
    for I trust in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not snatch your word of truth from me,
    for your regulations are my only hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will keep on obeying your instructions
    forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will walk in freedom,
    for I have devoted myself to your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will speak to kings about your laws,
    and I will not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How I delight in your commands!
    How I love them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I honor and love your commands.
    I meditate on your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember your promise to me;
    it is my only hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your promise revives me;
    it comforts me in all my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The proud hold me in utter contempt,
    but I do not turn away from your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I meditate on your age-old regulations;
    O Lord, they comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I become furious with the wicked,
    because they reject your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your decrees have been the theme of my songs
    wherever I have lived.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I reflect at night on who you are, O Lord;
    therefore, I obey your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is how I spend my life:
    obeying your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, you are mine!
    I promise to obey your words!
speaker: Narrator

text:
With all my heart I want your blessings.
    Be merciful as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pondered the direction of my life,
    and I turned to follow your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will hurry, without delay,
    to obey your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evil people try to drag me into sin,
    but I am firmly anchored to your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rise at midnight to thank you
    for your just regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a friend to anyone who fears you—
    anyone who obeys your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, your unfailing love fills the earth;
    teach me your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have done many good things for me, Lord,
    just as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I believe in your commands;
    now teach me good judgment and knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I used to wander off until you disciplined me;
    but now I closely follow your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are good and do only good;
    teach me your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arrogant people smear me with lies,
    but in truth I obey your commandments with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their hearts are dull and stupid,
    but I delight in your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My suffering was good for me,
    for it taught me to pay attention to your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your instructions are more valuable to me
    than millions in gold and silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made me; you created me.
    Now give me the sense to follow your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all who fear you find in me a cause for joy,
    for I have put my hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know, O Lord, that your regulations are fair;
    you disciplined me because I needed it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now let your unfailing love comfort me,
    just as you promised me, your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surround me with your tender mercies so I may live,
    for your instructions are my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bring disgrace upon the arrogant people who lied about me;
    meanwhile, I will concentrate on your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me be united with all who fear you,
    with those who know your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May I be blameless in keeping your decrees;
    then I will never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am worn out waiting for your rescue,
    but I have put my hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are straining to see your promises come true.
    When will you comfort me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am shriveled like a wineskin in the smoke,
    but I have not forgotten to obey your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long must I wait?
    When will you punish those who persecute me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
These arrogant people who hate your instructions
    have dug deep pits to trap me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your commands are trustworthy.
    Protect me from those who hunt me down without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They almost finished me off,
    but I refused to abandon your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your unfailing love, spare my life;
    then I can continue to obey your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your eternal word, O Lord,
    stands firm in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your faithfulness extends to every generation,
    as enduring as the earth you created.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your regulations remain true to this day,
    for everything serves your plans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If your instructions hadn’t sustained me with joy,
    I would have died in my misery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will never forget your commandments,
    for by them you give me life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am yours; rescue me!
    For I have worked hard at obeying your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though the wicked hide along the way to kill me,
    I will quietly keep my mind on your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even perfection has its limits,
    but your commands have no limit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, how I love your instructions!
    I think about them all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commands make me wiser than my enemies,
    for they are my constant guide.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I have more insight than my teachers,
    for I am always thinking of your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am even wiser than my elders,
    for I have kept your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have refused to walk on any evil path,
    so that I may remain obedient to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I haven’t turned away from your regulations,
    for you have taught me well.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How sweet your words taste to me;
    they are sweeter than honey.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commandments give me understanding;
    no wonder I hate every false way of life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is a lamp to guide my feet
    and a light for my path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I’ve promised it once, and I’ll promise it again:
    I will obey your righteous regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have suffered much, O Lord;
    restore my life again as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, accept my offering of praise,
    and teach me your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My life constantly hangs in the balance,
    but I will not stop obeying your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have set their traps for me,
    but I will not turn from your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws are my treasure;
    they are my heart’s delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am determined to keep your decrees
    to the very end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate those with divided loyalties,
    but I love your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my refuge and my shield;
    your word is my source of hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Get out of my life, you evil-minded people,
    for I intend to obey the commands of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, sustain me as you promised, that I may live!
    Do not let my hope be crushed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sustain me, and I will be rescued;
    then I will meditate continually on your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have rejected all who stray from your decrees.
    They are only fooling themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You skim off the wicked of the earth like scum;
    no wonder I love to obey your laws!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I tremble in fear of you;
    I stand in awe of your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t leave me to the mercy of my enemies,
    for I have done what is just and right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Please guarantee a blessing for me.
    Don’t let the arrogant oppress me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes strain to see your rescue,
    to see the truth of your promise fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am your servant; deal with me in unfailing love,
    and teach me your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give discernment to me, your servant;
    then I will understand your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, it is time for you to act,
    for these evil people have violated your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truly, I love your commands
    more than gold, even the finest gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Each of your commandments is right.
    That is why I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws are wonderful.
    No wonder I obey them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The teaching of your word gives light,
    so even the simple can understand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pant with expectation,
    longing for your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come and show me your mercy,
    as you do for all who love your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guide my steps by your word,
    so I will not be overcome by evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ransom me from the oppression of evil people;
    then I can obey your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look upon me with love;
    teach me your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rivers of tears gush from my eyes
    because people disobey your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you are righteous,
    and your regulations are fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws are perfect
    and completely trustworthy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am overwhelmed with indignation,
    for my enemies have disregarded your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your promises have been thoroughly tested;
    that is why I love them so much.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am insignificant and despised,
    but I don’t forget your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your justice is eternal,
    and your instructions are perfectly true.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As pressure and stress bear down on me,
    I find joy in your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws are always right;
    help me to understand them so I may live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pray with all my heart; answer me, Lord!
    I will obey your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry out to you; rescue me,
    that I may obey your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rise early, before the sun is up;
    I cry out for help and put my hope in your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I stay awake through the night,
    thinking about your promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your faithful love, O Lord, hear my cry;
    let me be revived by following your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lawless people are coming to attack me;
    they live far from your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you are near, O Lord,
    and all your commands are true.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have known from my earliest days
    that your laws will last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look upon my suffering and rescue me,
    for I have not forgotten your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Argue my case; take my side!
