    Protect my life as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are far from rescue,
    for they do not bother with your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, how great is your mercy;
    let me be revived by following your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many persecute and trouble me,
    yet I have not swerved from your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seeing these traitors makes me sick at heart,
    because they care nothing for your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how I love your commandments, Lord.
    Give back my life because of your unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The very essence of your words is truth;
    all your just regulations will stand forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Powerful people harass me without cause,
    but my heart trembles only at your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rejoice in your word
    like one who discovers a great treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate and abhor all falsehood,
    but I love your instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise you seven times a day
    because all your regulations are just.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who love your instructions have great peace
    and do not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I long for your rescue, Lord,
    so I have obeyed your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have obeyed your laws,
    for I love them very much.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I obey your commandments and laws
    because you know everything I do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, listen to my cry;
    give me the discerning mind you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my prayer;
    rescue me as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let praise flow from my lips,
    for you have taught me your decrees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my tongue sing about your word,
    for all your commands are right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me a helping hand,
    for I have chosen to follow your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I have longed for your rescue,
    and your instructions are my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me live so I can praise you,
    and may your regulations help me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I took my troubles to the Lord;
    I cried out to him, and he answered my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me, O Lord, from liars
    and from all deceitful people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O deceptive tongue, what will God do to you?
    How will he increase your punishment?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will be pierced with sharp arrows
    and burned with glowing coals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How I suffer in far-off Meshech.
    It pains me to live in distant Kedar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am tired of living
    among people who hate peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I search for peace;
    but when I speak of peace, they want war!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look up to the mountains—
    does my help come from there?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My help comes from the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not let you stumble;
    the one who watches over you will not slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, he who watches over Israel
    never slumbers or sleeps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord himself watches over you!
    The Lord stands beside you as your protective shade.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will not harm you by day,
    nor the moon at night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord keeps you from all harm
    and watches over your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord keeps watch over you as you come and go,
    both now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was glad when they said to me,
    “Let us go to the house of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And now here we are,
    standing inside your gates, O Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jerusalem is a well-built city;
    its seamless walls cannot be breached.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the tribes of Israel—the Lord’s people—
    make their pilgrimage here.
They come to give thanks to the name of the Lord,
    as the law requires of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Here stand the thrones where judgment is given,
    the thrones of the dynasty of David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pray for peace in Jerusalem.
    May all who love this city prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Jerusalem, may there be peace within your walls
    and prosperity in your palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of my family and friends, I will say,
    “May you have peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of the house of the Lord our God,
    I will seek what is best for you, O Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lift my eyes to you,
    O God, enthroned in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We keep looking to the Lord our God for his mercy,
    just as servants keep their eyes on their master,
    as a slave girl watches her mistress for the slightest signal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have mercy on us, Lord, have mercy,
    for we have had our fill of contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have had more than our fill of the scoffing of the proud
    and the contempt of the arrogant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What if the Lord had not been on our side?
    Let all Israel repeat:
speaker: Narrator

text:
What if the Lord had not been on our side
    when people attacked us?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They would have swallowed us alive
    in their burning anger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The waters would have engulfed us;
    a torrent would have overwhelmed us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, the raging waters of their fury
    would have overwhelmed our very lives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord,
    who did not let their teeth tear us apart!
speaker: Narrator

text:
We escaped like a bird from a hunter’s trap.
    The trap is broken, and we are free!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our help is from the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who trust in the Lord are as secure as Mount Zion;
    they will not be defeated but will endure forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Just as the mountains surround Jerusalem,
    so the Lord surrounds his people, both now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked will not rule the land of the godly,
    for then the godly might be tempted to do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do good to those who are good,
    whose hearts are in tune with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But banish those who turn to crooked ways, O Lord.
    Take them away with those who do evil.
May Israel have peace!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Lord brought back his exiles to Jerusalem,
    it was like a dream!
speaker: Narrator

text:
We were filled with laughter,
    and we sang for joy.
And the other nations said,
    “What amazing things the Lord has done for them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, the Lord has done amazing things for us!
    What joy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Restore our fortunes, Lord,
    as streams renew the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who plant in tears
    will harvest with shouts of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They weep as they go to plant their seed,
    but they sing as they return with the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Unless the Lord builds a house,
    the work of the builders is wasted.
Unless the Lord protects a city,
    guarding it with sentries will do no good.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Children are a gift from the Lord;
    they are a reward from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Children born to a young man
    are like arrows in a warrior’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How joyful is the man whose quiver is full of them!
    He will not be put to shame when he confronts his accusers at the city gates.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How joyful are those who fear the Lord—
    all who follow his ways!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will enjoy the fruit of your labor.
    How joyful and prosperous you will be!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your wife will be like a fruitful grapevine,
    flourishing within your home.
Your children will be like vigorous young olive trees
    as they sit around your table.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is the Lord’s blessing
    for those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord continually bless you from Zion.
    May you see Jerusalem prosper as long as you live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May you live to enjoy your grandchildren.
    May Israel have peace!
speaker: Narrator

text:
From my earliest youth my enemies have persecuted me.
    Let all Israel repeat this:
speaker: Narrator

text:
From my earliest youth my enemies have persecuted me,
    but they have never defeated me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My back is covered with cuts,
    as if a farmer had plowed long furrows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord is good;
    he has cut me free from the ropes of the ungodly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all who hate Jerusalem
    be turned back in shameful defeat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May they be as useless as grass on a rooftop,
    turning yellow when only half grown,
speaker: Narrator

text:
ignored by the harvester,
    despised by the binder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And may those who pass by
    refuse to give them this blessing:
“The Lord bless you;
    we bless you in the Lord’s name.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the depths of despair, O Lord,
    I call for your help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my cry, O Lord.
    Pay attention to my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, if you kept a record of our sins,
    who, O Lord, could ever survive?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you offer forgiveness,
    that we might learn to fear you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I long for the Lord
    more than sentries long for the dawn,
    yes, more than sentries long for the dawn.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He himself will redeem Israel
    from every kind of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, my heart is not proud;
    my eyes are not haughty.
I don’t concern myself with matters too great
    or too awesome for me to grasp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, I have calmed and quieted myself,
    like a weaned child who no longer cries for its mother’s milk.
    Yes, like a weaned child is my soul within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, put your hope in the Lord—
    now and always.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, remember David
    and all that he suffered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made a solemn promise to the Lord.
    He vowed to the Mighty One of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will not go home;
    I will not let myself rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not let my eyes sleep
    nor close my eyelids in slumber
speaker: Narrator

text:
until I find a place to build a house for the Lord,
    a sanctuary for the Mighty One of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
We heard that the Ark was in Ephrathah;
    then we found it in the distant countryside of Jaar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let us go to the sanctuary of the Lord;
    let us worship at the footstool of his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord, and enter your resting place,
    along with the Ark, the symbol of your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May your priests be clothed in godliness;
    may your loyal servants sing for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of your servant David,
    do not reject the king you have anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord swore an oath to David
    with a promise he will never take back:
“I will place one of your descendants
    on your throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If your descendants obey the terms of my covenant
    and the laws that I teach them,
then your royal line
    will continue forever and ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord has chosen Jerusalem;
    he has desired it for his home.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“This is my resting place forever,” he said.
    “I will live here, for this is the home I desired.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless this city and make it prosperous;
    I will satisfy its poor with food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will clothe its priests with godliness;
    its faithful servants will sing for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Here I will increase the power of David;
    my anointed one will be a light for my people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
    but he will be a glorious king.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
How wonderful and pleasant it is
    when brothers live together in harmony!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For harmony is as precious as the anointing oil
    that was poured over Aaron’s head,
    that ran down his beard
    and onto the border of his robe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Harmony is as refreshing as the dew from Mount Hermon
    that falls on the mountains of Zion.
And there the Lord has pronounced his blessing,
    even life everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, praise the Lord, all you servants of the Lord,
    you who serve at night in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift your hands toward the sanctuary,
    and praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord, who made heaven and earth,
    bless you from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Praise the name of the Lord!
    Praise him, you who serve the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you who serve in the house of the Lord,
    in the courts of the house of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
    celebrate his lovely name with music.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself,
    Israel for his own special treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know the greatness of the Lord—
    that our Lord is greater than any other god.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord does whatever pleases him
    throughout all heaven and earth,
    and on the seas and in their depths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He causes the clouds to rise over the whole earth.
    He sends the lightning with the rain
    and releases the wind from his storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He destroyed the firstborn in each Egyptian home,
    both people and animals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He performed miraculous signs and wonders in Egypt
    against Pharaoh and all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck down great nations
    and slaughtered mighty kings—
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
    Og king of Bashan,
    and all the kings of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave their land as an inheritance,
    a special possession to his people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your name, O Lord, endures forever;
    your fame, O Lord, is known to every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will give justice to his people
    and have compassion on his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The idols of the nations are merely things of silver and gold,
    shaped by human hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths but cannot speak,
    and eyes but cannot see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears but cannot hear,
    and mouths but cannot breathe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And those who make idols are just like them,
    as are all who trust in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, praise the Lord!
    O priests—descendants of Aaron—praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Levites, praise the Lord!
    All you who fear the Lord, praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord be praised from Zion,
    for he lives here in Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good!
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of gods.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who alone does mighty miracles.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who made the heavens so skillfully.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who placed the earth among the waters.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who made the heavenly lights—
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
the sun to rule the day,
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
and the moon and stars to rule the night.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who killed the firstborn of Egypt.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought Israel out of Egypt.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He acted with a strong hand and powerful arm.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who parted the Red Sea.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led Israel safely through,
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
but he hurled Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who led his people through the wilderness.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to him who struck down mighty kings.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He killed powerful kings—
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
and Og king of Bashan.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God gave the land of these kings as an inheritance—
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
a special possession to his servant Israel.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembered us in our weakness.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He saved us from our enemies.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives food to every living thing.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of heaven.
His faithful love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beside the rivers of Babylon, we sat and wept
    as we thought of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We put away our harps,
    hanging them on the branches of poplar trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our captors demanded a song from us.
    Our tormentors insisted on a joyful hymn:
    “Sing us one of those songs of Jerusalem!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But how can we sing the songs of the Lord
    while in a pagan land?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
    let my right hand forget how to play the harp.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O Lord, remember what the Edomites did
    on the day the armies of Babylon captured Jerusalem.
“Destroy it!” they yelled.
    “Level it to the ground!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Babylon, you will be destroyed.
    Happy is the one who pays you back
    for what you have done to us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy is the one who takes your babies
    and smashes them against the rocks!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I give you thanks, O Lord, with all my heart;
    I will sing your praises before the gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I bow before your holy Temple as I worship.
    I praise your name for your unfailing love and faithfulness;
for your promises are backed
    by all the honor of your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As soon as I pray, you answer me;
    you encourage me by giving me strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every king in all the earth will thank you, Lord,
    for all of them will hear your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, they will sing about the Lord’s ways,
    for the glory of the Lord is very great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though the Lord is great, he cares for the humble,
    but he keeps his distance from the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though I am surrounded by troubles,
    you will protect me from the anger of my enemies.
You reach out your hand,
    and the power of your right hand saves me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will work out his plans for my life—
    for your faithful love, O Lord, endures forever.
    Don’t abandon me, for you made me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you have examined my heart
    and know everything about me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You know when I sit down or stand up.
    You know my thoughts even when I’m far away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You see me when I travel
    and when I rest at home.
    You know everything I do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You know what I am going to say
    even before I say it, Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You go before me and follow me.
    You place your hand of blessing on my head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,
    too great for me to understand!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I can never escape from your Spirit!
    I can never get away from your presence!
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I go up to heaven, you are there;
    if I go down to the grave, you are there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I ride the wings of the morning,
    if I dwell by the farthest oceans,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even there your hand will guide me,
    and your strength will support me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I could ask the darkness to hide me
    and the light around me to become night—
speaker: Narrator

text:
but even in darkness I cannot hide from you.
To you the night shines as bright as day.
    Darkness and light are the same to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made all the delicate, inner parts of my body
    and knit me together in my mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thank you for making me so wonderfully complex!
    Your workmanship is marvelous—how well I know it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You watched me as I was being formed in utter seclusion,
    as I was woven together in the dark of the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You saw me before I was born.
    Every day of my life was recorded in your book.
Every moment was laid out
    before a single day had passed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How precious are your thoughts about me, O God.
    They cannot be numbered!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I can’t even count them;
    they outnumber the grains of sand!
And when I wake up,
    you are still with me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, if only you would destroy the wicked!
    Get out of my life, you murderers!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They blaspheme you;
    your enemies misuse your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, shouldn’t I hate those who hate you?
    Shouldn’t I despise those who oppose you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I hate them with total hatred,
    for your enemies are my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Search me, O God, and know my heart;
    test me and know my anxious thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Point out anything in me that offends you,
    and lead me along the path of everlasting life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, rescue me from evil people.
    Protect me from those who are violent,
speaker: Narrator

text:
those who plot evil in their hearts
    and stir up trouble all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their tongues sting like a snake;
    the venom of a viper drips from their lips. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, keep me out of the hands of the wicked.
    Protect me from those who are violent,
    for they are plotting against me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I said to the Lord, “You are my God!”
    Listen, O Lord, to my cries for mercy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Sovereign Lord, the strong one who rescued me,
    you protected me on the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, do not let evil people have their way.
    Do not let their evil schemes succeed,
    or they will become proud. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my enemies be destroyed
    by the very evil they have planned for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let burning coals fall down on their heads.
    Let them be thrown into the fire
    or into watery pits from which they can’t escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let liars prosper here in our land.
    Cause great disasters to fall on the violent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I know the Lord will help those they persecute;
    he will give justice to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely righteous people are praising your name;
    the godly will live in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I am calling to you. Please hurry!
    Listen when I cry to you for help!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Accept my prayer as incense offered to you,
    and my upraised hands as an evening offering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take control of what I say, O Lord,
    and guard my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let me drift toward evil
    or take part in acts of wickedness.
Don’t let me share in the delicacies
    of those who do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the godly strike me!
    It will be a kindness!
If they correct me, it is soothing medicine.
    Don’t let me refuse it.
But I pray constantly
    against the wicked and their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When their leaders are thrown down from a cliff,
    the wicked will listen to my words and find them true.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like rocks brought up by a plow,
    the bones of the wicked will lie scattered without burial.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look to you for help, O Sovereign Lord.
    You are my refuge; don’t let them kill me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me from the traps they have set for me,
    from the snares of those who do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,
    but let me escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry out to the Lord;
    I plead for the Lord’s mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pour out my complaints before him
    and tell him all my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I am overwhelmed,
    you alone know the way I should turn.
Wherever I go,
    my enemies have set traps for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look for someone to come and help me,
    but no one gives me a passing thought!
No one will help me;
    no one cares a bit what happens to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I pray to you, O Lord.
    I say, “You are my place of refuge.
    You are all I really want in life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my cry,
    for I am very low.
Rescue me from my persecutors,
    for they are too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bring me out of prison
    so I can thank you.
The godly will crowd around me,
    for you are good to me.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Don’t put your servant on trial,
    for no one is innocent before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemy has chased me.
    He has knocked me to the ground
    and forces me to live in darkness like those in the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am losing all hope;
    I am paralyzed with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember the days of old.
    I ponder all your great works
    and think about what you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lift my hands to you in prayer.
    I thirst for you as parched land thirsts for rain. Interlude
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come quickly, Lord, and answer me,
    for my depression deepens.
Don’t turn away from me,
    or I will die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me hear of your unfailing love each morning,
    for I am trusting you.
Show me where to walk,
    for I give myself to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me from my enemies, Lord;
    I run to you to hide me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me to do your will,
    for you are my God.
May your gracious Spirit lead me forward
    on a firm footing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the glory of your name, O Lord, preserve my life.
    Because of your faithfulness, bring me out of this distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your unfailing love, silence all my enemies
    and destroy all my foes,
    for I am your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, who is my rock.
    He trains my hands for war
    and gives my fingers skill for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is my loving ally and my fortress,
    my tower of safety, my rescuer.
He is my shield, and I take refuge in him.
    He makes the nations submit to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, what are human beings that you should notice them,
    mere mortals that you should think about them?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they are like a breath of air;
    their days are like a passing shadow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open the heavens, Lord, and come down.
    Touch the mountains so they billow smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hurl your lightning bolts and scatter your enemies!
    Shoot your arrows and confuse them!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their mouths are full of lies;
    they swear to tell the truth, but they lie instead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing a new song to you, O God!
    I will sing your praises with a ten-stringed harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you grant victory to kings!
    You rescued your servant David from the fatal sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me!
    Rescue me from the power of my enemies.
Their mouths are full of lies;
    they swear to tell the truth, but they lie instead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May our sons flourish in their youth
    like well-nurtured plants.
May our daughters be like graceful pillars,
    carved to beautify a palace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May our barns be filled
    with crops of every kind.
May the flocks in our fields multiply by the thousands,
    even tens of thousands,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and may our oxen be loaded down with produce.
May there be no enemy breaking through our walls,
    no going into captivity,
    no cries of alarm in our town squares.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, joyful are those who live like this!
    Joyful indeed are those whose God is the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will exalt you, my God and King,
    and praise your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise you every day;
    yes, I will praise you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is the Lord! He is most worthy of praise!
    No one can measure his greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let each generation tell its children of your mighty acts;
    let them proclaim your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will meditate on your majestic, glorious splendor
    and your wonderful miracles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your awe-inspiring deeds will be on every tongue;
    I will proclaim your greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone will share the story of your wonderful goodness;
    they will sing with joy about your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is merciful and compassionate,
    slow to get angry and filled with unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is good to everyone.
    He showers compassion on all his creation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of your works will thank you, Lord,
    and your faithful followers will praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will speak of the glory of your kingdom;
    they will give examples of your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will tell about your mighty deeds
    and about the majesty and glory of your reign.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom.
    You rule throughout all generations.
The Lord always keeps his promises;
    he is gracious in all he does.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord helps the fallen
    and lifts those bent beneath their loads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of all look to you in hope;
    you give them their food as they need it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you open your hand,
    you satisfy the hunger and thirst of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is righteous in everything he does;
    he is filled with kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is close to all who call on him,
    yes, to all who call on him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He grants the desires of those who fear him;
    he hears their cries for help and rescues them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects all those who love him,
    but he destroys the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise the Lord,
    and may everyone on earth bless his holy name
    forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Let all that I am praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise the Lord as long as I live.
    I will sing praises to my God with my dying breath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t put your confidence in powerful people;
    there is no help for you there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they breathe their last, they return to the earth,
    and all their plans die with them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But joyful are those who have the God of Israel as their helper,
    whose hope is in the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made heaven and earth,
    the sea, and everything in them.
    He keeps every promise forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives justice to the oppressed
    and food to the hungry.
The Lord frees the prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord opens the eyes of the blind.
The Lord lifts up those who are weighed down.
    The Lord loves the godly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects the foreigners among us.
    He cares for the orphans and widows,
    but he frustrates the plans of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will reign forever.
    He will be your God, O Jerusalem, throughout the generations.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
How good to sing praises to our God!
    How delightful and how fitting!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is rebuilding Jerusalem
    and bringing the exiles back to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He heals the brokenhearted
    and bandages their wounds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He counts the stars
    and calls them all by name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How great is our Lord! His power is absolute!
    His understanding is beyond comprehension!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord supports the humble,
    but he brings the wicked down into the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing out your thanks to the Lord;
    sing praises to our God with a harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He covers the heavens with clouds,
    provides rain for the earth,
    and makes the grass grow in mountain pastures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives food to the wild animals
    and feeds the young ravens when they cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He takes no pleasure in the strength of a horse
    or in human might.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No, the Lord’s delight is in those who fear him,
    those who put their hope in his unfailing love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glorify the Lord, O Jerusalem!
    Praise your God, O Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has strengthened the bars of your gates
    and blessed your children within your walls.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends peace across your nation
    and satisfies your hunger with the finest wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends his orders to the world—
    how swiftly his word flies!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends the snow like white wool;
    he scatters frost upon the ground like ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He hurls the hail like stones.
    Who can stand against his freezing cold?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then, at his command, it all melts.
    He sends his winds, and the ice thaws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has revealed his words to Jacob,
    his decrees and regulations to Israel.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Praise the Lord from the heavens!
    Praise him from the skies!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, all his angels!
    Praise him, all the armies of heaven!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, sun and moon!
    Praise him, all you twinkling stars!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, skies above!
    Praise him, vapors high above the clouds!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let every created thing give praise to the Lord,
    for he issued his command, and they came into being.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He set them in place forever and ever.
    His decree will never be revoked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord from the earth,
    you creatures of the ocean depths,
speaker: Narrator

text:
fire and hail, snow and clouds,
    wind and weather that obey him,
speaker: Narrator

text:
mountains and all hills,
    fruit trees and all cedars,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wild animals and all livestock,
    small scurrying animals and birds,
speaker: Narrator

text:
kings of the earth and all people,
    rulers and judges of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
young men and young women,
    old men and children.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He has made his people strong,
    honoring his faithful ones—
    the people of Israel who are close to him.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Sing to the Lord a new song.
    Sing his praises in the assembly of the faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, rejoice in your Maker.
    O people of Jerusalem, exult in your King.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise his name with dancing,
    accompanied by tambourine and harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord delights in his people;
    he crowns the humble with victory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the faithful rejoice that he honors them.
    Let them sing for joy as they lie on their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the praises of God be in their mouths,
    and a sharp sword in their hands—
speaker: Narrator

text:
to execute vengeance on the nations
    and punishment on the peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to bind their kings with shackles
    and their leaders with iron chains,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to execute the judgment written against them.
    This is the glorious privilege of his faithful ones.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise him for his mighty works;
    praise his unequaled greatness!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with a blast of the ram’s horn;
    praise him with the lyre and harp!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with the tambourine and dancing;
    praise him with strings and flutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with a clash of cymbals;
    praise him with loud clanging cymbals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let everything that breathes sing praises to the Lord!
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
